div.head: The Epistle Dedicatory. TO Mr JACOB THYSIƲS, a singular lover of Divine, and Naturall Wisdome, as also of the Mathematicks, and Astrology, and Geometry.
div.p:
BEloved Friend in the Lord; I wish to you and your loving ones from God abundance of grace and peace from Christ Jesus, and an enlightning of the Holy Ghost; the Apostle exhorts his Corinthians, and us, 1 Corinth. 14. Thus, Follow after Charity, and desire spirituall gifts, but the rather that yee may prophesie, for he that prophesieth, speaketh unto men, to edification and exhortation and comfort; Here the Apostle holds forth unto us three things, which wee ought to consider well; The first is Charity, in which wherewith and through which our Faith and Religion is justifyed, approved, and confirmed, and therefore where no Charity is, there the boasting and crying up of true Faith, and Religion is in vaine, and all knowledge, and whatsoever else may be is in vaine and of no use without Charity, as the Apostle speaketh plainly, 1 Corinth. 13. Now wee very well know that there is great disputing and arguing about Faith and Religion, amongst those which are taught of God, and can conclude or determine nothing therein, the Reason is
because they neither have nor know Charity, nor never knew the onely summe of Religion and true Faith in God which is Love, and Charity, of which we read in Math. 22. 37, 38, 39. Deut. 6. 5. in the 1 Timothy 1. 5. None is knowne of God, but he that loves God, 1 Corinth. 8. 3. and his Brother and Neighbour. 1 John 3. 11. 14. Therefore wee conclude of all men in the whole world, and of all their Beleivers, Religion and Gods worship, Chap. 4. ver: 7, 8. and Love is of God, and every one that loveth is borne of God, and knoweth God, but he that loveth not, knows not God, for God is love; and in his third Epistle, about the 11 v: sayth John, He that doth good is of God, but he that does evill does not see God, therefore this is the Conclusion of all men among all the Nations of the Earth, as the Holy Scripture speaketh, John 5. 39. Those that have done good shall rise unto Life, and those that have done evill shall rise unto Judgement; Therefore whatever man soweth, he shall reape also, whether it be good or bad; Therefore let us doe good, and not to be weary of it; Galat: 5. 8, 9, 10. Wherefore thus wee conclude of all mens Faith and Religion; That whosoever feareth God in what Nation soever and worketh righteous things, he is acceptable unto God, Act. 10. 35. Therefore let no man erre and be deceived through an empty and dead Faith; for none is justifyed of God, and to be able to enter into the kingdome of God, but he that worketh righteousnesse and doth the will of God, Math: 2. 21. 1 Joh. 3. 7, 8, 9, 10. It is he which shall abide for ever, Chap: 2. 17. and dwell on the holy Hill of the Lord, Psal. 15. and dwell on high, that is in heaven, Isaiah 33. 14, 15, 16. This now is the first thing the Apostle exhorts us unto, (to wit) Love, thereby is our Religion and Beliefe knowne, what he is, and what he hath to expect, Rom: 2.

Secondly, he exhorts us also that wee should strive
about spirituall things, or spirituall Gifts, and endeavour after them, the Reason why the Apostle admonisheth us unto them is, that we might grow rich in God through spirituall Gifts, in all manner of spirituall wisdome, and understanding, and knowledge in the Mystery of God the Father, and of Christ, 1 Corinth: 12. Ephes: 3. 16, 17, 18, 19. that our eyes may be enlightned through the Spirit of Wisdome and of the Revelation unto the knowledge of God, Ephes: 1. 17, 18. and Chap. 4. 13. that wee should not allwayes continue to be such children, that are driven by every winde of Doctrine, by the slight and cunning craftinesse of men, ver: 14, 15. but that wee might attaine unto the wisdome of the Saints, and of those that are perfect, which lye hid in the Mystery, of which, worldly men know nothing, nay it is hidd from the witty and wise men of this world; Math: 11. 25. Job 28. Wisdom 7. 10. 1 Corin: 2. 7, 8, 9, 10. Thus wee should strive after spirituall Gifts, that wee may learne to know the Mystery of God, Colos: 2. 2. and that all the treasures of Wisdome and knowledge are hidden in Christ, ver: 3. in regard of that knowledge all other things are accounted but Dung and double losse, Philip: 3. 7, 8. Thus shall wee be rich in God, and perfect, enriching others also; Thus the Corinthians according to the exhortation of the Apostle, who strove after Spirituall Gifts, and prayed to God for his Holy Spirit, and they were replenished with all manner of spirituall Gifts; for when they assembled together in the Congregation every one made shew of his Gifts to the praise of God and to the edifying of the Congregation, as it plainly appears, 1 Corin: 14. But where are now adayes such Congregations and spirituall Gifts? Are wee not rather derided by those which have not the Spirit? when we are zealous about the Spirit, and spirituall Gifts, and doe
accuse us of seven and eight Devills, and that we have a familiar spirit; Nay it is so, but the Lord commeth and will judge it.

Thirdly, the Apostle admonisheth us to endeavour after prophesying, and 1 Thess: 5. 19, 20. he sayth, Quench not the Spirit, despise not prophesying; the Quaere here now is, what signifyes properly to prophesie, and what is the spirit of prophesying? Answer; These are the Prophets, which have the Spirit of the Testimony of Jesus Christ, Revel: 12. 17. Chap: 19. 10. Then wee aske what is the Testimony of Jesus Christ? Answer; This is the Testimony of Jesus Christ, and the Spirit of prophesying, That Jesus Christ is the Sonne of the living God, and the true God himselfe, and not a creature as Adam was, and all are; Math. 16. 13. 16. 1 Joh. 5. 15. 10, 11. 12. 20. And thereby wee know that wee have the Spirit of prophesying, and the Testimony of Jesus Christ, if wee speake of Christ divinely, and not humanely, Math: 16. 23. if we speake the words of God and not of Men, thereby wee know that wee are of God and are sent of him; Joh. 3. 34. 1 John 4. 5, 6. 1 Peter 4. 11. Therefore the Spirit of prophesying, hath the true Doctrine, and Testimony of Jesus Christ, for he speaketh divinely, and with such words which the Holy Ghost teacheth, and not the spirit of this world, which teacheth words of humane wisdome, and not words of God; 1 Corinth: 2. 12. Chap: 2. 12, 13. Now through the spirituall Doctrine the Congregation of God is builded on the spirituall Rocke, and foundation, which is Christ; Chap: 10. 4. Ephes: 2. 20. On which Foundation and Rocke, our most holy Faith is grounded as on God himselfe, and not on any Creature.

Secondly, the Congregation is admonished and exhorted by prophesying, 1 Corinth: 14 3. and meliorated, ver: 4th, that shee in her wisdome should take heed
of such who are earthly minded, for through the spirits of errours the Congregations are scattered, as appeareth plainly by all humane sects, the Reason is because the false Prophets deny Christ, and with forged words worke on men, and have not the Testimony of God and of Christ, nor the spirit of prophesying, but the spirit of this world, in a Wisdome which is from below; James 3. 15. according to the Flesh, which is in enmity against God; Rom: 8. 5, 6, 7, 8.

Thirdly, and lastly, wee are through the Spirit of prophesying comforted in that which is to come, Namely, that wee shall be redeemed from this world, and from all miseries, therefore the Spirit of prophesing foretells us of future things, for our comfort, that wee may keepe faith in Patience, and be circumspect, and long with the whole Creature, after our Redemption, on which wee waite and depend; Rom: 8. 21, 22, 23. Thereupon the Prophesie foretells us of the kingdome of God, and of the end of this world, with the extirpation and destruction of all the wicked, and of the true peace, and eternall Joy, as also of the great Glory in the future World of the kingdome of God, of which wee comfort one another, and rejoyce in that which is to come.

Now such a thing, namely, that which is to come, is foretold also in the Treatise called Postilion, through the Gift of Prophesing, though this our Prophesing, be not so perfect, yet, he who is spirituall, and a Prophet in the Congregation of the Lord, will not despise it, but remember what the Apostle sayth, 1 Corin: 13. 9. That our prophesing is but in part. But the Reason why I dedicated this Treatise to my Loving Friend, and published the same in his Name, because he is a Lover of the Divine, and Naturall Wisdome, and searcheth after Truth, in one or other, and waiteth
with me and all true beleivers, and with the whole Creature, upon the Generall Redemption neere at hand as possibly may be credited; Therefore my intent and purpose is to bring in this Booke this glad tydings, and sure Newes; First to all the select beleivers, then to the whole people of Israel, and Juda, and at the last to Heaven and Earth, and all the Creatures therein, especially seeing a good Message is acceptable, and I make no doubt but it will be so received, (as it is intended) first by you, who is my Deare Friend in Christ; next by the Christians and Jewes, and at last of the Spirit of all the Creatures, who with me joyntly expect their Redemption, for which God the Creator of all things make us fit and worthy; whose Name be praised for ever, to whose Grace wee recommend our selves.

closer.signed: Your Loving Friend, and Servant. Postilion.
closer.dateline: Dated at Amsterdam the 15th of January, Stilo Novo. 1655.

div.head: A Preface to the Reader.
div.p: IT is almost Naturall to Man, that he is desirous to heare Newes, in case he be not deceived, and endamaged thereby, as our first Mother Eve, who hearkned to the Serpent, who by the seduction of of the Devill, told to her Newes also, whereby shee was so much deceived, that not onely Adam, and Eve, and all wee with them, but Heaven and Earth also, and all what therein is, are fallen into great Necessity, Death and Misery, and continue still therein even till now; whereas it is meete for a Watchman which standeth on the Guard Day & Night to be faithfull and diligent in his Office, and to tell of that which he seeth comming a farre off, that with a good Conscience he may say before God as it is written in the Prophet Isaiah, Chap: 21. 8. My Lord I stand continually upon the Watch Tower in the day time, and I am sett in my Ward whole Nights; Therefore I thought it fit to make mention and give notice of, and withall to commend my Office that I may not stand ashamed at the Lords comming.

Whereas, many things have been foretold hitherto of Peace, so that all men wished and longed after it, yet the Watch man on the Tower of the Lord sayth thus; 1 Thes. 5. 3. For when they shall say peace and safety, then sudden Destruction commeth on them, as Travaile upon a Woman with Childe, aad they shall not escape; Therefore I speake to you of the sword, and not of Peace, foreseeing the sword comming on my Tower, and truely I have declared it many yeares agoe, and have been taxed for it heavily, and I must thinke of an Answer to him that Rebuked
for it; Now the Lord sayth thus, Write the vision, and paynt it on a Table, that the passers by, may read it; Thus, The Prophesie shall be yet in due time accomplished, and will at the last fully come to passe, even to the Day, and will not tarry, and though it tarrys waite thou neverthelesse, for it will assuredly come, and that not long; But he that is obstinate, shall finde no Rest in his Heart, for the Just liveth by Faith: Because I see the sword comming, therefore I forewarne you of it, and that indeed a Triple sword, over the three States of the World, as you will Read anon in this our Almanacke and Prognostication; therefore doe not take it ill but consider what is written; Ezek: 33. and that you may not fall into Tymorousnesse and dispaire, I foretell you also of a Peace, but of such a Peace, which men doe not make, but of such a one which the Lord God will make, as you shall heare afterwards, and that Peace will last firmely for ever, and shall never be broken againe; Psal: 72. Isai: 9. 7. Now that every one may know, as it were in a short Compendium, what the Newes is which I am to declare to all? To it I answer, that it is this, That not onely wee Men, but also Heaven and Earth, and all what therein is shall be renewed, and all the Calamities which have befallen us and all the Creatures by reason of sinne, and have lasted now these 6000 yeares, shall be taken wholly away at once, and all shall be turned into such a good state and glory, as it was before the fall of Adam and Eve, and this will come to passe at the Glorious and joyfull comming of our Lord Jesus Christ, by such a means, that the Tree of Life shall and must be broken, through which breaking all shall come to right and good againe, even as by the breaking of the former Tree, and by the enjoyng of its fruite, all is come into evill and Death; This is the joyfull Tydings which wee tell unto you, in the Name of the Lord who hath sent me; Now he that beleiveth it, and repenteth truely, desisting from evill, and doing Good, and calleth on the Name of the Lord, he shall not onely see and enjoy that
Newes which wee tell you of, but will be delivered also from all Mischiefe and Misery; as it is written, Psal: 27. 13, 14. Joel 2. 32. And this now is the seale of God, whereby are knowne those that belong to God, namely, Faith, Love, and Hope in the Holy Ghost, He that hath this Seale, him the Lord knoweth, and it is he who knows, and is knowne of the Lord, 2 Tim: 2. 19. 1 John 2. 3, 4, 5, 6. 1 Corinth: 8. 3. Such a one who hath this Seale and maketh shew of it in True Repentance, and in a godly Life and conversation before God and Man, shall not be touched by the sword, and the Destroying Angel, according to the promise in Ezekiel 9. 4, 5, 6. Apocalyps 7. 3. But he that hath not this Seale in his Forehead, which Forehead, is his dayly life and conversation, he will be touched and destroyed by the sword, and by the Locusts, and by the foure Destroying Angells, though he were a Prophet, even as Bileam was, Revel: 9. 4. Numb. 31. 8. But to speake in one word what the Seale of God is, wherewith the Children of God are sealed, viz. the holy Spirit of God and of Christ, whereby wee know the Children of God; but he that hath not this Seale, and this Spirit, he is not the Child of God, Rom: 8. 9. 15. 2 Corinth: 1. 21. 22. Ephes: 1. 13.

Whereas Astrologers and Almanackmakers, usually calculate Nativities for Men, touching their Fortunes, therefore wee intend to doe the like, so that every man be he of what state and condition soever, hath his Nativity hereby sett in the aforesaid Seale, according to which he may undoubtedly and assuredly regulate his life, as in one word for the Generall, but concerning the particulars, they shall follow in order in our sequent Almanacke and Prognostication, and in that manner, that every one shall admire; the Reason whereof is this, because some Newes is told, which formerly other Ages have not heard of, as it is written, Isaiah 48. 6, 7. Which newes, or new thing is this, namely, that all shall be renewed, and the Tree of Life shall be broken, and its fruit shall be eaten
and enjoyed, and all things shall be ordered and regulated in so good away, as it was before the fall, and the whole Creature shall be delivered from Vanity and Misery; Acts 3. 20, 21. Dan: 9. 24. Rom: 8. 21. Isaiah 65. 17. 25. Chap: 11. 6. 2 Peter 3. 13. Psal: 102. 27: Heb: 12. 27. Now of this joyfull Newes never any Astrologer or Almanackmaker hath written, the reason of it was, bocause the Booke of Heaven was sealed from them hitherto as all other Bookes; Isaiah 29. 10, 11, 12. and God mocketh them, Chap: 47. 11, 12, 13, 14, 15. and know not that Babylon shall fall and suddenly be Ruined; and indeed I have often wondered, that not any of them should ever have made mention of it, and that all the Almanackmakers and Astrologers, should be so ignorant and starke blind, that they could not take notice of the Transcendently great alterations over Heaven and Earth, and over the whole World; but truely the Cause is this, that they have not studied nor learned their Astrology out of the holy Scripture, and know not this one thing, whether the Sunne, or the Earth stands still, or which part is in its Revolution? Is it not a sinne, and shame? Now if the true Astrologers will rightly view and consider the booke of Heaven, then they will finde wonders upon wonders, to which this our New Almanacke and Prognostication will minister sufficient occasion, for the Time is come that all bookes shall be opened which hitherto have been sealed; Because that Time is come, in which this World shall be sealed, and a New World shall be Revealed, as wee have declared unto you, and hath been prophesied of, 4 of Esdras 6. 20. Therefore wee will not hold forth unto you this our New Almanacke and Astrologicall Prognostication without the holy Scripture, but rather wholly out of it, except what perticular Conjectures shall be inserted, so that the Reader himselfe may peruse the booke of the Lord with those of Berroha, and search therein whether the things be so as St Paul hath told them, Isa: 34. 16. Acts 17. 11. Wherefore least any one should be deceived, for the holy
Scripture is as full of Mysteries as the Firmament is full of Starres, he that can Read therein to whom they stand open, and hath received of the Angel, with John and Ezekiel, the Booke opened, little or nothing will be concealed from him but he will be able to prophesie to the Gentils and Nations, and to many Kings, Revel: 10, 9, 10. 11. Ezek: 3. 3. Now of this Prophesing you shall heare all along in this Prognostication, the Father of Lights, from whom all good Gifts come from above, who liberally distributeth his Gifts to all those, who aske of him for his Wisdome, will be pleased to enlighten us altogether, that our Darknesse, and our Lampe may be enlightened from above to behold the Light in his Light, to the praise and honour of his Name, and our salvation, Amen; Psal: 18. 29. 2 Sam. 22. 26, 27. Psal. 36. 10.

div.head: Postilion. Or a New ALMANACKE AND Astrologicke, prophetical, Prognostication.
The First Chapter. Of the Time, Age, and Yeare of the World, and what is the true Calculation thereof, which hitherto hath not been knowne.
div.p: THe Holy Ghost by Saint Paul exhorts us in this manner; Ephes: 5. 14. Awake thou that sleepest and arise from the Dead, and Christ shall give thee Light; ver: 15. See then yee walke circumspectly, not as Fooles but as Wise; ver: 16. Redeeming Time because the dayes are evill; ver: 17. Wherefore be yee not unwise, but understanding what the will of the Lord is, Rom: 12. 2. Whereas Almanackmakers sett the Time in the Frontispeice of their Almanacke, namely, the Yeare of the World, therefore wee will keepe the same order, and in the first Chapter, wee will speake of the Time, of the Age, and Yeares of the World in a just and right Chronologie out of the ground of the holy Scripture, and that for this Reason, because the Time runneth to an end, from whence wee shall know and observe, rejoycing and comforting our selves the more, because our Redemption draweth nigh.

Now whereas the World was created of God in six dayes, and on the seventh day all was accomplished, then God rested the seventh
day &c. Thereupon wee will conclude according to the Grace which God hath bestowed on us in the Spirit of prophesie, that the World shall also last six dayes, or six thousand Yeares, but the seventh Thousand Yeare will be the Sabboth and Rest in these thousand of yeares, of which is plainly spoken in the Revelation. Now of this Sabboth you may read and exactly consider the Scripture, Heb: 3. and 4. Levit: 25. and make a diligent search what it may signifie, why God hath sanctified the Seaventh day, and commanded the same to be kept holy; Exod: 20. 8. Deut. 5. 12. and what wee are to consider thereby, and that wee should not any longer continue in ignorance, but be understanding and rational, and Remember the Sabboth what it signifies, and intimates unto us, and not to looke upon it as a Cow on a New Gate (as the usual proverbe is.)

Now as the World was created in six dayes, and that out of the water, 2 Pet. 3. 5. through the Spirit, which moved on the water, who keepeth the water by his power in a Fluidnesse continually; whereby wee may perceive how the Fountaines arise and spring, because there is in the Water a Living Spirit, and a Stirring Winde, which driveth and moveth it, keeping it in a continual Fluer; Thus much intimateth unto us also the Ebbing and Flowing of the Sea in its six houres Ebbing and six houres Flowing; the time of these six dayes and six thousand yeares, and the twelve houres in the Revelation, the twelve houres of the Master of the house, which now are counted as for one Day, Math: 20. Which Ebbing and Flowing of the Sea Water in its mystery shall of us be exactly viewed and considered; and although hitherto none could finde out, or tell the true cause of this Ebbing and Flowing of the Sea Water; Neverthelesse, wee will reveale the same herewith unto you, Namely, the Spirit, through which the World was made out of the Water, the same is indeed in the Water with his Winde, which stirreth and moveth it; Now the Spirit is in both Poles, the Articke, and Antarticke, out of his Transcendent Spheare, wherein he fullfilleth the whole Circumference of the World, Wisdom 1. 7 in a very little Center with all his fullnesse, as corporeally contracted, and concentrated; and a True Magnett which attracteth the Waters which at the beginning of the Creation, were begotten out of the Winde and Spirit, and so respireth, or deduceth againe in six houres, according to the Number of the six Dayes, and twelve houres of the
Creation, and also of the Time of the World; Now this Spirit of the World dwells likewise bodily in the two Poles on which the World is firme, and hangeth thereon as on the Navel String, and so becomes the Navel of the World, where the whole world in the water floweth in and out, and wherein it dwelleth also with all its fullnesse, as in a Concenterated Center.

Now this Spirit of the world dwelleth also in the despicable Magnett; This is the Reason why the Magnett continually poynteth as it were with Fingers at the Pole, which doth teach and demonstrate unto us, that the Spirit of the world dwelleth in the Pole, and that wee also ought to enquire and search after what it signifies, attracting to us the Spirit from above, even as the Magnett drawes the Iron on the one side, and repercusseth to the other, which Mystery hitherto hath been concealed from those who in their clearest sight are blinde; And there is such a Mystery in the Water by Reason of the Spirit which is therein, that no man can beleive, namely, a Magnetick power to attract, and take away all Diseases, be they called what they will, if the mystery of the water were knowne; and least you should thinke I mocke, and tell Fables unto you, Then Remember the Fountaines which cure Diseases, and consider what is written, 2 Kings 5 10. &c. John 5. 4. Chap: 9. 7. 11. And why Christ hath instituted the Baptisme with water, &c. And he that hath an uncleane skinne, or hath any other soares, or Cresences, let him but wash himselfe with or in the Sea-water at the Decrease of the Moone when it ebbeth, he will be pure and healed of those uncleane Cresences, and then you will know the wonders of the waters, and consider of them better.

In the Balticke Sea, there is neither Ebbing nor flowing, the Reason is, because it is not opposite to the Pole; But why these Mysteries have not been hitherto revealed; Is this the Reason, because our Phylosophers know not the Principles, and Elements, and powers of the World, though there were never so many of them; Now there is not foure but seaven Elements and Powers of the World, Namely, Spirit, Aire, Water, Light, Heaven, and Earth: The water is the Center corporeally, and stands onely in the middle; But the Fire is no Element, but an opposite Element, of which more is spoken in our sphere of Wisdome, or Revelation of Wisdome, wherein is found the key unto Wisdome &c. But let no Man marvell; for the Time is come at last in which all things concealed shall be Revealed.

Now concerning the Yeares of the World, from Adam to the Deluge there are 1656 yeares; From Noah to Christ are 2574 yeares: Thus Christ is borne in the yeare of the world 4230; and wee write in 1646 yeare, the yeare of the world 5877. The ground of the Computation and Calculation, of the middle Joynt or Member (to wit) the 2574 yeares wee take from the speech of the Angel unto Ezdras the Prophet out of the fourth Booke of Ezdras, in the 14 Chap: and the 11th verse: These 12 parts you may consider, which beginne not from Adam, but from Noah for a direction to you; Christ was borne on the third Sabboth yeare of the 31 Jubile yeare, and was baptized by John in the 31 Jubile-yeare according to our thinking and conjecture; in the 30 yeare of his Age, and in the middle of the weeke (Namely) in the last and seaventh weeke of the 32 Jubile yeare, was Jerusalem destroyed, and the Sacrifice abolished according to the Prophesie of Daniel, Chap. 9. ver: 27.

Now the 6000 yeares shall not be accomplished, but shall be shortned for the Elect sake; These abbreviated yeares wee leave to the omniscience of the Almighty; But those who have the Spirit of Wisdome, to them wee hold forth that which the Angel sayd unto Ezdras, the 4th Chap: 7th ver: 28. 30. Inquire diligently into the Computation of those 400 yeares and 7 dayes, and you will finde them also in Ezdras, and then you will know the Mystery, and that which wee have mentioned in the Preface of the Sabboth. Furthermore, concerning the Time you must know that the Time of the abomination of Destruction will expire and come to an End in the 1290 dayes after 1600. And wee consider very well what the new Starre 1604, hath told and intimated to the Magi of the East, namely, the Nativity of the Childe of the woman, Revel: 12. of which in our Sermon preached on the Gospel on the Day of the apparition of Christ, and written on the last ended Moneth of March; The great Blazing Starre Anno 1618, hath sounded the Seaventh Trumpett for an Alarme to all the world, which you cannot gainesay, and foretold the Ruine of all Kingdomes, and Kings of the Earth, and the Judgement over the World, and the comming of the Lord; Hitherto wee are in the 5th Viol, which manifestly will shew it selfe in the yeare 1655, and that very powerfully; For you see how the kingdome of the Beast is darkened, and then the foure destroying Angells, which hitherto were bound shall be loosed,
whose office and effect, read, Revel. 9. 14, 15. of whom this is our meaning and opinion, that they will hold and gather in the great Harvest, described, Revel: 14. and that the crooked Sickle, and the knife for cutting the Clusters, is the Turke, which will come with foure great and mighty Potentates to make a horrible slaughter, but presently after shall be destroyed, and in a way of prophesing I hold him to be the great River Euphrates, on which the 6th Viol is to be powred out, dryed up, and perish, for another People shall come into his Countrey, which goeth also through the River Euphrates, which shall be even dryed up; what manner of people this is Read Esdras 13. 40, &c. For God will doe even the same Miracles which he did when Israel came out of Egypt, concerning which read Isaiah 11. 15, 16 Chap: 24. 14. Chap: 27. 12, 13. Jerem: 31. 9. Micah 7. 15. This People of the Tenn Tribes of Israel shall come with their Kings from the East through Euphrates; Revel: 16 12. Which now dwelleth behinde the Meridional Pole in the unknowne Land not knowne of us as yet, but shall be now found and knowne by the powring of the 6th Viol: We are fully of opinion that the Turke, will make a prey upon these two Partyes falling out and fighting one against another.

Thus wee conclude the First Chapter of our Prognosticks, the event whereof Time will teach, in the meane while, let the well wishers and Daniel his Fellows read the 11th and 12th Chapters of the 4th of Esdras, of the three headed Eagle, and consider of it, according to my conjecture the Turke will be the first that will perish.

div.head: The Second Chapter. Concerning the true, infallible, and assured signe of the End, whereby the End may be knowne.
div.p:
TO this Quaere Christ answereth most gratiously, Math: 24. 14. Where he setts downe some signes and prophesieth, that the end is not yet come: But afterwards he sayth thus; And
the Gospel of the kingdome of God shall be preached in all the world for a witnesse unto all Nations, and then shall the end come; Mark: 13. 10. This signe will be when that huge and terrible slaughter is passed, thereby it will be knowne; Zepha: 3. 8, 9. You may read the whole Prophet of Zephany, because he fully prophesieth of the last time: Now whether Christs prophesie will be accomplished will appeare, when first that great and bloody Battaile is passed, in which the Turke perisheth. The Reason of the Sermon on the Gospell of Gods kingdome, you must understand thus, (viz.) That all the kingdomes of this world shall be destroyed, and the kingdome of God of which wee shall speake more anon in its proper Chapter, and moreover you must understand, that, whereas Christ makes heavy complaint against false Christs, and false Prophets, that by them in these last Times if it were possible the very Elect might be seduced, Math: 24. 27. Namely, into Errours, and sayth expressely, Luke 18. 8. Thinkest thou that the Sonne of Man at his Comming will finde Faith on Earth? Which are very hard words, yet dares any man be so impudent as to give Christ the lye herein; Let men boast and be never so confident of their True Faith, yet here they must lay their hands on their Mouths, unlesse they will spet in Christs face for saying so.

Whereas the Gospel of Gods kingdome shall be preached, and it shall be the signe of the End, it is to that purpose, that thereby appeareth the transcendent Love of God towards all men, Ezek. 18. 23. 32. Chap: 33. 11. 1 Tim: 2. 4, 5, 6. Now least he come and strike the Earth with Banishment; Therefore he hath promised that he will send unto us the Great Prophet Elias, who shall convert the hearts of the Fathers to their Children, and the hearts of the Children to their Fathers, Mala: 4. Therefore when the Day of Perdition of the wicked is past, then the Sonne of Righteousnesse will arise in the eternall Gospel of the kingdome of Heaven, and then the great Prophet Elias shall be revealed in his Sermon, which will not be a Sermon sayd in such words as I have heard ere now, it will be sayd Love, wee must Love one another, whereby it will be knowne that wee are of God, and are his Children, 1 Joh: 4. 7. Chap: 5. Joh: 13. 34, 35. For Love is the Covenant of our Fathers, Mala: 2. 10. And by this Sermon of Love, Elias will turne the hearts of the Fathers and of the Children one to another, and prepare the Way for the Lord, which commeth, for he is an Angel,
and a Messenger of the Lord Zebaoth; Chap: 2. ver: 7. and Chap: 3. and the same Angel by whose Lusture the whole world shall be enlightned, Revel: 18. Thus will it be Light in the Time of the Evening, Zacha: 14. 7. Therefore the Gospel of his kingdome, will be begunne by his Prophet Elias, who is yet in the Wildernesse; for it is the Evangelist of Sion which is promised to Jerusalem, and the same Messenger, which brings to all Israel, both to the Jewes and Gentils a joyfull Message and eternall Gospel, for that Reason is he termed an Evangelist, Isaiah 40. 9. Chap: 41. 25, 27. In the Originall Tongue it does not signifie a Preacher, but so, I will give to Jerusalem an Evangelist, Chap: 52. 7 Nehemiah 1. 15. And this is properly the Angel with the eternall Gospel, Revel: 14. 6. Which foretold also hitherto the destruction of the Great Whore of Babylon, which is the false Christendome, and the reestablishing of the kingdome of God, and of Israel. Thus you are exactly to observe, and to be fully perswaded that at the preaching of Elias and of the Gospel of the kingdome in the whole world, that there will then be Revealed the onely true and saving Faith and Religion, and then there will be one Flocke, and one Pastor, John 10. 16. Which should move us to rejoyce heartily at it and be highly comforted thereby, because that at the last, this happy and joyfull Time will be at hand in which these things shall be accomplished, and then Men will not trouble their heads so much about Religion and Faith, whether they beleive rightly or no, but it will suffice that by this one word Love, the Right Religion and true Faith may be knowne, for Elias will put all the Prophets of Baal to the sword, and will destroy them by the sword of the Spirit wherewith he killeth Antichrist, and makes an End of him, as the Type in the old Testament sheweth unto us, 1 Kings 18. 21. even to the end; which false Prophets have told unto the People, and to Kings, not onely other Gods, but have also enticed them unto Warres, that they and the people might perish together as hitherto it fell out.

Therefore Antichrist which is the Lying Spirit, must be destroyed, not onely with the bodily but also with the spiritual sword, of which read the 2d Thessal: 2. 8. Isaiah 11. 4. Zach: 4. 6. Which sword of the Spirit is the word of God, Ephes: 6. 17. Heb. 4. 12. Revel: 19. 13. 15. Therefore you must understand and judge of it aright (namely) that Antichrist which is the lying Spirit in the mouths of all false Prophets, is not killed and destroyed with the
hand, but with the Mouth, that is, with the Spirit of the Mouth of Jesus Christ, as the Scripture plainly expresseth; 2 Thess: 2. 8. Isaiah 11. 4. Which wee put you in minde of, because you may the better conceive of the sence, and meaning of the Scripture.

Now this Antichrist, and all false Prophets of Baal, and false Christs, and Children of Belial, are those who say, come let us worship other Gods, Deut: 13. 13. the same will Elias reveale unto you at his Comming; it is not fit for me, neither doth it belong to my office, but his it is that hath the Spirit of whom it is foretold, 4 Esdras 11. 37. and 12. 31, 32, 33. who shall set them a life before the Judgement of God, as Elias did with the others, 1 Kings 18. and will openly rebuke, convince, and condemne them, and will teach againe the people the true Faith, Religion, and Worship of God, and will announce to the Remnant of the people Go • d and pleasant things, and an eternall Redemption, and refresh them untill the Lord commeth and the day of Judgement, the great and terrible day of the Lord, the like never was, nor will come hereafter, 4 Esdras 12. 34. Isaiah 2. 11. and Joel 2. 2. 2 Thessal: 1. 8. &c.

Now the Spirit commeth in, and from the North, and from the Rising of the Sunne (namely) in the North, where they are all asleepe, Math: 25. and his Face is shining as the Sunne, and bath the gratious Token on his Head, (to wit) That God before the End of the World will Raise the Sonne of Righteousnesse by the preaching of the Gospel of the kingdome of God to all Nations, and Kindreds, Languages, and People, Revel: 14. 6. And that God will take pitty on his people Israel; His feete are like to two fiery Pillars, wherewith he stands on the Sea and Land; that is, the secular and spirituall Antichrist, with an exceeding great Zeale; and it is Elias which distributeth the little opened Booke, as you shall know afterwards, on which the Spirit of Zeale of the Lord Zebaoth resteth, Isai: 9. 2. 7. Chap: 11. And it is that Lyon, which roareth, and thundereth, making Heaven and Earth Tremble; of which read 4th Esdras 12. 31. Jeremy 25. 30. Joel 3 16. Amos the first; And he will speedily come forth out of his Denne and the Cloud wherewith he is encompassed shall be put away, Jeremy 25. 38. and because I see him already comming, and heare him Roaring, therefore would I make you acquainted with it, Amos 3 7, 8. So that when he commeth you may know him, and he will be as a Father to the House of Juda and to those at Jerusalem, Isaiah 22.
21, 22. And as you were told already, will Reunite the hearts of the Fathers and Children one towards another; Of this Angel, and his Comming, none for ought I know, hath prophesied among the Astrologers, unlesse Paulus Nagel, and Jacob Bohmen, of blessed Memories, who have been the Glory in the Spirit.

Whereas the Comming of Elias is so plainly foretold in the Prophet, that God will send him before the last Day, Mala: 4. Therefore I thought good to intimate him the more unto you, that you may know him when he commeth, and you may thinke then on me; and it is none else but that Angel which is described in Revel: 10. and which riseth with the Morning Starre at the apparition and Revelation of Jesus Christ on his Day, Luke 17. 22. and the Dawning of the Day, Isaiah 8. 20. and the Light, Zachary 14. 7. and the Day of the Lord, in which wee rejoyce so much, Psal. 118. 24. and the Sonne of Righteousnesse, Mala: 4. and with him appeareth the Woman clad witht he Sunne, the Congregation of the Lord, Revel: 12. and the glorious Luster whereby the whole earth is enlightned, Chap: 18. and the signe of the Sunne of Man in Heaven, and the Comming of the Lord, Math: 24. 30. 2 Thessal: 2. 8. He that hath Eyes let him see, and he that hath eares let him heare, and he that hath understanding let him Judge.

div.head: The Third Chapter. Of the Nativity of the Romane Empire, how it is undone, and of what is prognosticated of it.
div.p: WEE have made a Promise unto you in the Preface, that wee will not hold forth unto you, our Prognostication without the Holy Scripture, least you should imagine wee preach Fables and Lyes unto you; Now whereas every one would willingly know what Issue & Event in all these Warres &c the Roman Empire will winn or have; Wee will therefore tell you that also which wee have seene on the Watching Tower, which I shall endeavour so farre to satisfie you, that you may not contradict me or give me the lye.

Now Concerning the Romane Empire, I hope you will grant without deniall that it is the fourth Beast and Kingdome on Earth, of whom the Angel hath foretold to the Prophet Daniel, Chap: 7. especially because at the End of the same Kingdome, the comming of the Sonne of Man is described, and after it there ariseth another Kingdome, which is called the Holy One, of which hereafter; Now the Angel describeth this fourth Kingdome thus; The fourth Beast will be the Kingdome on Earth which will be greater than all Kingdomes, and will devoure the whole world, trample, and grinde them; and then ten Kings will arise in the same Empire, and another after these will succeed, and be more potent then the former, who shall abase and humble three Kings, and he shall speake words against the Most High, and trample upon the Saints of the Highest, and will presume to Alter Time and Lawes, and they shall be delivered into his hands for a Time, Times, and halfe a Time; afterwards Judgement will be give, so that his Power shall be taken away, trod underfoote from the bottome, even to the End: Now here is the Nativity of the Romane Empire, which in the fourth of Esdras, is called the Eagle, and in the Revelations it is called the Beast, what manner of Prognostication doe you thinke this is? Now which is that Horne, which warreth against the Saints, hath overcome them, trampled on them, and made an End of them; the same of which wee Read also in Revel: 13. 7. can yee guesse it? or hath it not already been made knowne to you in a Booke published by one, calling it The Looking-Glasse of Monarkes; therein is more at large described the Nativity of the Romane Empire, and of the Blasphemous Horne.

What happened at the Prauge in the yeare 1618, and 1621? pray looke into the 11th and 12th Chapters of the Revelations; Now what will befall this Horne, Beast, and House, the Great Tower in Spaine will come to Ruine, your eyes shall behold it, and the Beames of the great House will breake for all its Posts and Foundation, begin already to shake, of which you may Read Isaiah 2. 15. Chap: 30. 25. Habba: 2 6, 7, 8, 9, 10, 11, 12. The Day is come in which the Lord will visit the Leviathan, both at Sea and Land, with his strong and revenging sword, and will destroy the great Whale at Sea; Isaiah 27. Therefore doe not beleive the Peace, for the Lord Zebaoth hath bent his Bow, and layed deadly Arrowes on it; he hath prepared his Arrowes for Destruction;
Therefore that Crosse also must be crucifyed which hath crossed so many Thousands of soules, as you well know, and hath Hanged them up here and there; Therefore the Spirit sayth thus; Woe unto thee thou Destroyer, when thou hast done destroying, thou thy selfe also shalt be destroyed, Isaiah 33. for as one hath wrought so shall he receive his Reward also, neither Counsell nor Deed will helpe.

Now wee Read in the Prophet Daniel, Chap: 7. 11. and 4th of Esdras 12. and Revel: 19. 20. with this unanimous witnesse that the Beast and Eagle shall be burnt with Fire, and shall be cast into the fiery Lake, which burneth with Fire and Brimstone; This is its Nativity and astrologicke propheticall Prognostication, which is made for the Romane Empire and Blasphemous Horne, for so many Yeares agoe; and that by Angells which are farre better Astrologers of it, then our Almanack-makers and false Prophets, which love to flatter, and indulge themselves with the false Prophet, the Pope at Rome; and seduce the Beast to warre against the Saints, to persecute, destroy, and roote them quite out; Therefore he shall receive alike reward with the Beast; Read Isaiah 44. 25, 26. Chap: 47. 12, 13, 14, 15. Why have you not made a Nativity for the Romane Eagle? Nay you know not your owne Nativities, then how can you calculate them for others? doe but Read in the aforesaid quoted places of the Holy Scripture; Now wee let you know this that the Body of the Beast and Eagle is already kindled, and stands in a Glowing Heate, nay it flames out already, and no man can quench this Fire; But this is onely the beginning of it, and it will be more incensed by the foure Destroying Angells, so that the Blood shall reach even to the Horses Bridles by the space of 1600 Furlongs, Revel: 14. 20. Therefore I can tell you no other, but that which I have observed already on my watching Tower; if it be not so, or will not come to passe in the like manner, then chide me, but if it so happen, then thinke not on me, but on him that hath revealed it to me, who is the Spirit of the Prophets; Therefore, Judgement is come upon the Romane Empire, and it is the finall Judgement, and the Three Times and a halfe are almost expired, and the sett Time 1650, the period of the Great House, is come to an end, then reckon backe of 350 yeares, then the Lyon out of the Forrest hath sett the Eagle already before Judgement; the execution will come as Lightning, unexpectedly, and the Earth shall Tremble at it, and be afraid; 4th Esdras 12. 3. Now Judgement is come not
onely upon the Eagle and the Beast, but also upon all other Beasts, and upon all the Kings of the Earth; Read Zephany the 3d and the 8th; Esay 2. 13, 14, 15, 16, 17, 18, 19, 20. 22, 23, and 24 Chapters. Jeremy 25. For the wrath of God, and his heavy, and finall Judgement is come upon all the Heathens to destroy them, which have ruined, and destroyed the Earth, Revel: 11. 18. For the great Trumpet in Heaven in Anno 1618 hath sounded this Judgement, and indeed the Iron Rodd stands ready here, and is against Kings; Psal: 2. 9. Revel: 2. 27. Chap: 12. 5. Chap: 19. 15. Therefore this our Prognostication, (namely,) that all Kingdomes and Kings of this world will goe to wracke, and indeed, that in so few yeares, that hardly it will be beleived, though it should be told; Therefore there is no prefixt Time concerning it, because it is already so nigh at hand; Therefore there will be wonderfull Alterations in Governments, many High Potentates, and all great things, and high Persons will suddenly come to an end; Isaiah 2. One House after another, will goe to Ruine and Decay, one mischance and misery will fall upon the other; Chap: 24. Jeremy 25. And Seaven Times seavenfold Plagues; such Calamities there will be, that the like hath never been seene on Earth, since Men were from the beginning of the Creature, Daniel 12. Math: 24. 21. Luke 21. 26.

Now when the Turke hath made that great slaughter, and himselfe perish also, then indeed the Gospel of the Kingdome will be preached in all the world, but then the Devill also will send abroad his Prophets, Apostles, and Ministers, according to the 6th Viol, which will be the three unclean Spirits, as they are spoken of, Revel: 16. 13, 14. They then will seduce and entice the Kings of the Earth, and Gog and Magog also, which is the great Duke in Mas
• hoch, and Thubal, not the Turke, to goe to the Warres on that great Day of the Almighty, then all the Heathens the Kings of the Earth, the Beast, the last Romane Emperour, together with the false Prophet, the Pope at Rome, and Gog and Magog, with all his Hoast shall come to the Hills of Israel, and to the valley of Jehosaphat, and there they shall be judged of God at the glorious comming of Jesus Christ, and the Beast and the false Prophet are layd hold on, and shall be cast alive into the fiery Poole; of which read the 4th of Ezdras 13. Isaiah 24. 21, 22. Ezek. 38, and 39. Joel 3. Zach: 14. 3. &c.

This exceeding great warlike preparations and gatherings together
of the Heathen, shall be caused by the Returning of the Tenne Tribes of Israel, and the Returning of the Jewes to their Inheritance and Countrey, whom the Heathens intended to destroy, which the Lord judgeth; Now when you shall see and heare of this signe, that these preparations for Warres beginne to happen, then be assured most firmely, that the Comming of the Lord is at hand, which wee most faithfully doe intimate unto you for your direction.

But now to tell you, who shall be the last Emperour, I have not seene, but I guesse, that the Lilly will put on the Crowne and Name of the last Beast will containe the Number 666. But I am not sure of it, for I am no Prophet, or Soothsayer, but am counted a lyar as all men are, Neverthelesse, the Time will speedily discover it, and it is difficult and dangerous to particularize and poynt at, therefore wee commit it to God and the Time.

div.head: The Fourth Chapter. What manner of Empire will succeed, after the Romane Empire is ended, and who shall take possession of the Kingdome.
div.p:
THe Prophet Daniel answers plainly in expresse words, Chap: 2. and 7. saying, But the Kingdome, and the Power and Glory of the Kingdome, under the whole Heaven, or under all Heavens, shall be given to the People of the Saints of the most High, whose kingdome is an everlasting kingdome, and all Kings shall serve and obey him; also ver: 14. And the Antient gave to the Sonne of Man, Power, Glory, and Dominion, all People, Nations, and Languages, shall serve him; his Power is everlasting, which shall not be taken away, and his Dominion shall not be destroyed: Here is a Quaere whether this kingdome be of this World, for the kingdome of Christ is not of this world, John 18. 36. To which Daniel answers, saying, Chap: 2. 44. In the Times of these kingdomes the God of Heaven will Raise a kingdome which shall never be destroyed, and that kingdome shall not be left to a strange People, it will Destroy and Grinde all these kingdomes,
its selfe will endure for ever; As you have seene a Stone cut off from a Mountaine, without Hands, and that it brake in Peices, the Iron, the Brasse, the Clay, the Silver, and the Gold: Now seeing the God of Heaven will establish this kingdome, therefore it is not of this world, but necessarily it is from Heaven, and though it is and shall be under Heaven and on Earth, and that the Saints of God after the order of Melchizedech, shall be Kings, and Priests on Earth; Therefore it is a Holy kingdome, because meerly Righteous, and no sinners shall be therein, for the Devill is cast into the Abysse, that he shall seduce no more; of which Read, Psal: 45. 47. 93. 97. 99. 110. and many other Psalmes, also the 72 &c. Isaiah 60. 21, 22. Revel: 5. 10. Chap: 20. 3, 4, 5. Isaiah 2. Mich: 4. Obediah ver. 21. Zach: 14. 9. Then shall be accomplished the Eight Psalme, and whatever is prophesied in the Psalmes; and Prophets of Christs kingdome.

Now if any should chance to deride, mocke, and calumniate, and brand it with the word Millenaryes; let him reade his owne judgement, Revel: 22. 19. Mala: 4. He that denies the kingdome of God shall perish with the kingdome of the Devill, if he repents not, and beleiveth not the Gospel of the kingdome which Christ causeth to be published, Math: 24. 14. therefore let every one stand to his hazard, 2 Thes: 1. 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10. If it be asked what kinde of Stone was it which was pulled without hands from the Mount Sion, which striketh at the Feet of the great Image of the foure Kingdomes of the Earth making it fall, and commeth to an end? Answer; It is that Stone which lyeth before the High Priest Joshua, Zach: 3. 9. Which is called Zema, Oriens, and in the 8 verse, and Chap: 6. 12, 13. The same Stone which now shall be layd for the Foundation of him that buildeth the Temple of the Lord, and the Citie Jerusalem, which Stone the Babylonian builders have hitherto rejected, as it is written, Isaiah 28. 16. Psal: 118. 22. Which is the spirituall Rocke, 1 Corinth: 10. and indeed is nothing else but the glorious Epiphany of Jesus Christ at his Comming, and the Revelation of the Sonne of Man at his Day, 2 Thessal: 2. 8. Luke 17. 24. &c. It is the Child which shall feed all Nations with an Iron Rod, Revel: 12. 5. Therefore take notice of the second Psalme; for now is the Time of it.

It is written in the Prophet Daniel, that the Stone comes off from Mount Sion without mans hands; what is meant thereby? Answer
The Prophet Zacha: 4. 6, 7. Because it is a spirituall Stone, and is the Spirit of Christ, the Spirit of Judgement, as wee have shewed unto you, 4 Esdras 2. 31, 32. Isaiah 11. 4. 2 Thessal: 2. 8.

Therefore wee are not told of a worldly kingdome in the Gospel of that kingdome, but of a spirituall kingdome which God establisheth without Hands and power of Men; Therefore it will abide for ever; now this kingdome is and will be the kingdome of Israel, which the Lord Zebaoth will establish againe through the true king David Jesus Christ, who is the most holy, who shall, and is anoynted to be king for ever over the house of David, for he will be also Pastor, King, and Priest after the order of Melchisedech, Psal: 110. Ezek: 37. 16. 24. Zacha: 6. 13. Daniel 9. 24. Ezek: 34. 23. Jeremy 23. 5, 6. Thus Israel and Juda shall be helped, as God hath promised, Chap: 33. 16. They will no more have two, but one Head, their true and loving David, and Messias, whom indeed hitherto they have not Received, but now they will seeke after him, Hosea 1. 11. Chap: 3. 4. 5. 2 Chron: 15. 3. whom the others have crucified, these now will bewayle him heartily in true sorrow and Repentance, Zacha: 12. 10, 11, 12, 13, 14. And all the kindred of the Earth will howle and weepe with them when they shall perceive his Comming, Math: 24. 30. Revel: 1. 7. Then shall be accomplished the words of Christ, Math: 23. 29 Saying, You shall not see me untill you say, Blessed is he that commeth in the Name of the Lord, then they shall know him when they exalt him, Joh: 8, 28. Hitherto the Gospel could prevaile nothing in the Cities of Israel, and is accomplished what Christ sayd, Math: 10. 23. But now the Gospel of the kingdome shall be preached unto them also, and they will Receive it of the Evangelist who is promised to Jerusalem; Isaiah 40. 9. Chap: 41. 26. Which is none else but Eliakim, or Elias, Chap: 22. 21. Mala: 4.

What shall wee now prognosticate here in this our new Almanacke; such Newes which never was knowne before? It is this; That the Lord will Reestablish the kingdome of Israel; and free the Captives out of Sion, and gather together the scattered Israel, and turne away their Captivity, and though they be thrust out even to the end of heaven, yet will the Lord fetch them from thence againe, and be mindfull of his Covenant, which he hath sworne to Abraham, and his seede for ever; of which you may read; Deut: 4. 30, 31. Chap: 30. Isaiah. 11. 11. and Chap: 27. 12, 13. Chap: 51. 10, 11.
Jere: 31. Ezek: 34, 35, 36, 37 Chapters: Chap: 29. 25, 26, 27, 28, 29. Daniel 9. 24. Hosea 1, 2, 3. Joel 3. Amos 9. 11. and Mica: 2. 12, 13. Chap: 4. Chap: 5. 7. and Chap: 7. 15, 16, 17, 18, 19, 20. Haba: 3. 9. Zepha: 3. 10. Hagg: 2. 22. Zacha: 9. 13. &c. Chap: 10. Chap: 12. 13, 14. Mala: 3. 6. &c. Briefly, it is so plainly prophesied in the Psalmes and Prophets, that Israel and Juda shall have deliverance, and Returne againe to Sion, that it cannot be exprest more plainely; The Apostle calls it a Mystery, Rom: 11. 25. giveth a warning to the Gentils to take heed of being lofty and high minded, because Blindnesse happened to Israel; Therefore when the fullnesse of the Gentils is come in, then salvation happeneth to all Israel; because from Sion shall come their Deliverer to take away their Iniquity, and deliver them from all their sinnes; Rom. 11. 25, 26, 27. Psal: 130. 8. Psal: 22. 28, 29. and so Christ himselfe sayth, Luk: 21. 24. They shall fall by the sword and be carryed Captive among all the Heathens, and Jerusalem shall be sacked by the Heathens, till the Times of the Heathens are accomplished; But now whether the Time of the Heathens be expired, and the kingdomes of the World fall home to the Lord and his Anoynted; You may enquire of the Angel who hath sounded the seventh Trumpet, and of the Blazing Starre, Anno 1618; and perhaps other Messengers from Heaven will come and tell of it; Therefore for my part I can discover nothing more from my Tower and Guard; But what I heard of the Lyon; Isaiah 21. 8. 4 Esdras 11. 37, 38. Jeremy 25. 30 Joel 3. 16.

Now in case any one should except against, he excepts not against me, but against him who hath placed and sett me on the Tower for a Watchman to tell you of it, and it is effected to that end, that you with all the Saints should Rejoyce for and in this kingdome of God, but the kingdome of God and Israel, shall not be established by the Hands of Men, and not by humane might, sword, and Power, but in the Spirit, and through the Spirit, and no otherwise; and to this, none will lift up so much as a sticke, much lesse a sword or speare; for it will not be any worldly kingdome, but the Scepter of the Mouth of him that commeth will slay them all.

Therefore the Stone is come downe from the Mount Sion without Hands of Men, because this will be done, not by a Warlike Power, but through his Spirit; Zach: 4. 6 Therefore he that shall, or will be a partaker of this kingdome, let him become a Jew,
and Confessor of Jesus Christ the Sonne of God, what manner of confession this is, Elias will tell it at his Comming.

div.head: The Fifth Chapter. What manner of Nativity is set for the Dragon, and the Devill, who is God and Prince of this world, as also for his Angel and Servants.
div.p:
TO this Answers the Prophet, Isaiah 24. 21. Namely, That the Prince on high with his Hoast shall be visited, gathered, cast into Prison, and lockt up: The same we read also Revel: 20. Now the Dragon is a God, and Prince of this World, 2 Corinth: 4. 4. Joh: 14. 30. Chap: 12. 31. dwelleth and ruleth on high in the Ayre under Heaven, and carries on his affaires among the Children of Disobedience, (or infidelity) Ephes: 2. Chap: 6. 12. Thus the Devill hath in the world his kingdome in the Ayre; where his Principalities and Powers and Angels dwell (Namely) unto the Globe and Spheare of Luna; as farre as the Darknesse reacheth, which wee cannot see; because our Eyes are not opened, and the Devills kingdome on high is spirituall; But the Dragon is become so high by Reason of Mans fall, for his sinne from the beginning of the world, and because he hath caused Man to fall, therefore he must also fall, as he is fallen also already; And I have seene him lying on the Ground bruised and crushed in his Backe, Head, Hands, and Feete, and in his Wings also, lying Dead, and these words lay written by it; Violenta violenta, Flagitiosa, scilicet Mors: That which I have seene also that he was thrust out; viz. I saw a House which was raised, from, or above the Earth, there was a Great Gate towards the North, which was opened, there came one to stand in the middest of the Gate as I conceived it was the Angel of the sixth Congregation, he spyed Sathan walking to and fro under the formes in the same Roome, in the shape of a Red Dogg, he was very loath to get out of that Roome in which he abode so long, but he must come out, he came forth by the Right Foote of the Angel that stood in
the middest of the Gate, I thought to my selfe he might bite him in the heele, and my eye was fixed on it, but he durst not meddle with him as I perceived, neither did he; Now when Satan was turned out, then the Angel lifted up his face to God with hearty inward sighing, saying, Ah now let the Lord say Amen, seven times, I constered it thus; that Satan should never come againe into the Roome; Thus the Gate is opened to the Angel which no man can shutt; But what one he is Elias the Prophet at his comming will tell it; This vision I have seene in a Citty which beareth the key, namely, a Lyon with the key; In which Citie I have seene many other things besides: As how the Temple also was opened, and I have seene also the Lord Rising from the Dead.

The vision of the open Gate I have seene Anno 1625. the first of January in the Morning betwixt six and seaven on New yeares Day; Now when Christ commeth then will you see this vision, and you will behold it with your bodily eyes, and rejoyce with me heartily, and be thankfull unto the Lord for it. And least you should thinke I hold forth unto you Visions and Fables, therefore you may read the Truth your selves, namely, that Satan the great Dragon was turned out and cast forth out of Heaven upon the Earth, Isaiah, Chap: 14. v: 12. &c. Revelt. 12. v: 9. &c. and seeing he was cast forth made him so fierce and wrathfull, for he knoweth that his time is but short, therefore was he so enraged from the yeare 1618. when his being cast out was plainely intimated and demonstrated to the world in the Head Citie of the Lyon, even till now both at Sea and Land, and his Rageing will begin afresh, though the people talke of peace, yet perdition will fall on them suddenly as travaile upon a woman with Child, and they shall not be able to escape, and now more violently then was done hitherto, experience will testifie of it fully, both by Sea and Land, and you shall not need to contradict me.

Now is the Time come of the great Warres and battailes, the like was not since the world was, nor shall be, namely, betwixt the two potent Princes, between the great Prince and Archangell Michael, and betwixt the Prince of this world the Dragon, the old Serpent the Devill; For the great Prince Michael who stirred now to guide his people Israel, as it is prophesied in Daniel 12. hath fought with the Dragon and conquered him, and thrust him out by the blood of the Lambe, and through the word of their Testimony, and through
their fidelity unto death; so that he can no more accuse the servants of God day night before God, and there is no place to be found for him in Heaven, therefore is now the joyfull time once come that the people of Israel shall be delivered, because the 70 weekes and the 1335 dayes are expired, where the iniquity will be forgiven, and wickednesse will be at an end, the sinne blotted out, and the eternall Righteousnesse is brought againe which hitherto was lost through Adam, therefore every vision and prophesie shall be fullfilled, and the most holy to be anoynted a King for his kingdome, Dan: 9. 24. Acts 3. 19, 20, 21. The abomination of desolation shall be abolished, and the Sanctuary shall be cleansed againe, for the 2300 dayes come to an end, Dan: 8. 14. Therefore as in former times the Law and the Prophets have prophesied to John the Baptist, even so it is now also, all prophesies goe till Elias who is the last Prophet who is promised in its time to us before the comming of the Lord, with him they cease, and every prophesie is accomplished, & from henceforth no Prophet or prophesie will be, and through him also the impure Spirit will be rooted out from the Earth, of which you may Read Zachary 13. And every one shall have for himselfe a new Baptisme for his sinne and uncleannesse, like an open fountaine, like as Jordan was to Naaman the Syrian, 2 Kings 5 Now as John of old baptized with water unto Repentance, so Elias is to baptize us with the holy Ghost not long after these dayes, which is God the Lord of this baptisme and of these wholesome fountaines is prophesied, Isaiah 12. 3. Chap: 44. 3. Zacha: 12. 10. Chap: 13. Jere: 31. 33. Ezek: 11. 19, 20. Chap: 36. 25, 26, 27. Joel 2. 28. But he will baptize the wicked with fire and sword, as he did in times of old, therefore I can give you no other signe whereby you might observe all this then the signe of the Prophet Elias, who ascended to Heaven in a fiery Chariot, and returneth also in the name of the Lord on a fiery Chariot, but who can brooke with the day of his comming, because it will be as fire, Mal: 3. and you shall heare and know it, if you have not already heard it, that never any man on the earth hath ever spoken so sharply, the Reason is because his Tongue is like a devouring fire, Isaiah 30. 27, 28, 30. &c. which cansumeth and swalloweth up all, Chap: 42. 13, 14. and the Spirit of both witnesses of the old and New Testament resteth on him; he hath power to shutt and open heaven, to transmute water into Blood, and to strike the earth with all monner of plagues as often
as he pleases, Revel: 11. Whereas a Nativity is sett for the Devill and the Dragon, and he must come downe into the goale & abysse, then with him downe must come all the Kings of the Earth, Isaiah 24. 21. and the Beast, Revel: 19, 20, 21. and the Dragon in the Sea, Psal: 64. 12, 13, 14, 15. Isa: 27. And wee will tell you, what wee have seene in the vision of our Ward, namely, a number of Oxen and fatted Beasts driven together, because the King which prepareth for the nuptials of his Sonne will slay and kill these Oxen and fatted Beasts, Math: 22. 4. Psal: 68. 31. Therefore come hither yee Gentils and hearken, and yee Nations take notice of it, read it your selves, Isa: 33. and observe the whole Chapter very well for all the hoast of heaven, Ephes: 2. 2. Chap: 6. 12. must downe and fall off as a leafe which is withered, therefore I have seene that all high lookes must come downe, and all those that strive for high things, and to be somewhat looked upon amongst men; but the Lord alone will be so high and exalted on that day, Isaiah 2. 11. It is a very hard word, Revel: 13. that the Dragon hath given his power, his stoole, his great power to the Beast, whereby it hath supprest and persecuted the Saints, and that those which dwell on the earth, and are earthly minded doe worship both the Beast and Dragon also, therefore the Beast together with the Dragon must into the poole which burneth for ever, Revel: 19 20. Chap: 20. 10. Seeing the Dragon is cast and throwne out of heaven, and must be flung into the Abysse and a seale putt upon him, so that he shall seduce no more, then there will be no more sinne and no more Death, but a fullnesse of joy and a pleasant being eternally, and wee have cause heartily to rejoyce, meditate of it, and comfort our selves therewith about it.

div.head: The Sixth Chapter. What Astrologicall Prognostication is set for Heaven and Earth, Sunne and Moone, the whole world, and all the creatures therein.
div.p:
SEing there is an usual discourse of Nativities among Astrologers, therefore wee also will sett a Nativity for Heaven and the Astralls thereof, which shall be nothing else but a new birth, a renewing
and transmutation, namely, that Heaven and Earth shall be renewed, Sunne Moone and Starres and all other creatures none excepted, you Mathematicians, Astronomers and Astrologers, have you never seene nor read it in the booke of Heaven, then make use of Spectacles, perhaps you may spy it yet, or can you not discover with the Astralobes, and observe what they say; for the whole Creature in Heaven and in Earth speake with one mouth of renewing of all things, for the Creature also shall be delivered from the bondage of vanity and corruptiblenesse to a freedome of the glory of Gods Children, Rom. 8. 12. What doe you thinke of this saying? The Apostle Peter answers plainly to this Quaere. 2 Pet. 3. 13. Wee waite for a new heaven and a new earth, according to his promise in which dwelleth Righteousnesse; and so sayth the Prophet Isaiah also Chap: 65. 17. Chap: 66. 22. This renewing will be done through a great motion, and transmutation, Haggai 2. 7. Heb: 12. 17. The Apostle Peter sayth, 2 Pet: 3. 10. 12. That the Heaven will be dissolved with Cracking, that is, with a moving of their powers, as Christ sayes, Math: 24. 29. (as it were delivered from the bonds of their impurity wherewith they are hitherto bound, and defiled with sinne) Job 15. 15. and are fiery, that is, goe through the fire as gold and silver is cleansed and purified in the fire throughly, Luke 21. 33. namely, which takes away all impurity and keepeth or preserveth the purer part; the concordance in the Psalme expounds it more plainely and calls it a transmutation, Psal: 102. 27. So that the substance and being remaineth, but the qualities which appertaine not to the purity, are taken away, then the heavens will praise the judgement of God when their iniquity is taken away, Psal. 50. 6. Psal. 8. 4. and declare his righteousnesse, Psal. 97. 6. Thou wilt change them as a garment, and they shall be transmuted, Psal: 102. 27. You may conceive of it thus, as a pure incombastible Linnen is cleansed from its impurity through fire, that it be very white new and pure; even so the heavens also shall be purified, and the earth also shall goe through the fire and be purged from the Curse and sinne, and the workes which are therein shall burne away, and this will be done not onely to heaven and earth, but also to all men, as the Apostle plainely saith, 1 Corinth: 3. 13, 14, 15. And Christ tells us, Mark: 9. 49. That every man shall be seasoned with fire; all this you shall be better informed of by him which commeth after me, viz. Elias. Seeing there will be such a sharpe processe,
as Christ and his two chiefest Apostles attest namely, that all must goe through the fire, even all men and all their workes, therefore I know no better advice to hold out in this sharpe and fiery Trial, but that we fit and prepare our selves for the comming of the Lord, in which time all this shall come to passe by a holy conversation, as St Peter doth exhort us unto and that wee suffer our selves to be baptized of Elias with fire and the holy Ghost, and with the salt of Wisdome be seasoned, then wee may hold out in the fire for nothing indures in the fire but salt, of which Elias will tell you more, and be not refractory against him when he commeth to you with the fire of Judgement, and with a mighty sharpe punishment; but if yee be refractory, then the sword will destroy you, and the fire will consume you; Behold, I have told you of it aforehand forewarned, fore-armed, Isa. 1. 20 Chap: 66. 16.

If it be asked what manner of fire it will be, by and through it heaven and earth Sunne and Moone, and all the Starres shall be purged; from whence doth it come, and whither doth it returre? I have seene none else but the fiery Cherub which lyeth still before the gate of Paradice which must remove from thence at the Lords comming, and must give a free passage to the Tree of Life; This fire is the power of the opposite Element, and the last wrath, in which fire, Heaven, Earth, and all what therein is shall stand, and this shall be that fire also which is to fall upon God and Magog and on the great Multitude of those which intend to fight against him which is to come, Ezek: 38. 22. Chap: 39. 6. 4 Esdras 13. 10, 11. And into this fire shall be cast also alive the Beast and the false Prophet, and have a fiery poole for their dwelling, and goe downe to the Abysse downe to the pit which is already prepared, since yesterday, and is wide and broad enough for the King, Isaiah 30. 33. Revel: 20. 20. Into which at the last shall be cast also Hell, Death, and the Devill, Chap: 21. 10 14 Seing the heavens shall be renewed, then the hoast of heaven, Sunne, Moone and Starres shall be renewed in this manner, that the luster of the Sunne shall be greater seaven times then it is now, and the luster of the Moone shall be such as the Sunne now hath, namely at that time when the Lord will dresse the wounds of his people, and heale their plagues, as it is plainely prophesied, Isaiah 30. 26. But before that time Sunne and Moone shall be darke and blacke, and the Starres fall downe from Heaven, alitle before Christs comming and will be ashamed before the Lord
that commeth, and before his terrible wrath at the day of Judgement Isa: 24. 23. Luke 21. 25. Revel: 6. 12, 13, 14. Therefore the Eclipses of the Sunne and Moone which we behold are a forerunner of these great Eclipses which are to come; and Astrologers ought to consider the true cause of the Eclipses of the Sunne and Moone Naturally, that it is from sinne through which the heavens also were defiled and could not keep pure, Job 15. 15. When Adam and Eve transgressed and fell, and at the renovation they shall be pure agen: Moreover the Sunne and Moone receive their Eclipses by the sleering and envious looking or beholking the Darknesse, and of the Devill the Prince of Eclipses in the Ayre, who with his poysonous sleering and envious Eyes defyleth Sunne and Moone and Starres, no otherwise then as when a menstruous Woman defileth a pure glasse by looking in it, for the impurity of the Woman proceeds and hath its cause from sinne, and all wee are conceived and borne in such an impurity; Neither is the Gall in man a member created of God in man at the beginning, but is growne by and of eating the forbidden fruit and is a meere poyson which shall be taken away agen at the renovation of man, and of all things in the world (and by reason of sinne Christ must drinke Vineger mixt with Gall, Math: 27. 34. John 19. 29.) Then surely no more of any Eclipses will befall the Sunne and Moone, neither will the Moone be in an increase or decrease nor the night be so darke as it is now, neither will there be any such frosty Winters nor cold nor frost; because all opposite and contrary things will be taken away and cease; and as there was no enmity at all at the beginning betwixt the Woman and the Serpent, betwixt the Wolfe and the Lamb, then there will be not any strife or enmity neither at that time, then will the Lord make a Covenant with the beasts of the field with the birds of the Ayre, and the Wormes on the earth, Hosea 2. 18. Isaiah 11, 6, 7, 8, 9. Chap: 43. 19, 20. Chap: 65. 25. And this is it, which the Apostle speakes of, Rom: 8. 21. that the creature shall be freed from the bondage of vanity, therefore the eternall Gospel of the kingdome of God and of the glorious and joyfull Redemption is annuntiated, not onely to man, but also to heaven and earth, Sunne Moone and Staares, and to all other Creatures under the whole heaven and on earth in an eternall Redemption from all Evill, and from sinne the Devill and Death, at which Redemption the Glory of the Children of God will be
but then revealed, for the which all the Creatures together with us have waited anctiously and sighingly, Rom: 8. 19 22. Hee that hath eares let him heare.

div.head: The Seaventh Chapter. What Prognostication is set for Generalls, Officers and Souldiers, and other Commissaryes and Collectors of Contributions.
div.p:
WHereas this Generation delights in Warre happily I may doe them service, because I must Prognosticate for them also, as they might be pleased with it; therefore I can say nothing else, then that which I have seene on the Guard, namely, Warre and the sword, and indeed more terrible then ever it was, therefore whereas they dreame now of a peace, then the warres will more fiercely come on, therefore let them not be sad and melancholy if they are disbanded for a little season, for I see the sword comming over all the Inhabitants of the earth, Jere: 25. 29. If it commeth upon all, surely at the last it will come upon you also: Christ himselfe hath made a Prognostication for your Nativity, viz: Math: 26. 52. Those that take the sword shall perish by the sword, unlesse such men did turne betimes and seriously repent, and confessed their murtherous deeds and heavy sinnes at the Crosse with that murtherer, happily they might finde pardon and Remission, otherwise the place where they must goe is called Armageddon, that is, damned Warriors, Revel: 16. 16. But that none may come to that torment I will impart unto you a good advice from the Mouth of him who hath before set the Prognostication to your Nativity, which is this, viz: Whatsoever you would have men to doe or not to doe to you, so you must doe or not doe to them, Math: 7. 12 John the Baptist interpreteth it thus, being asked of Souldiers what are wee to doe? hee told them, Doe violence to no man, neither accuse any falsely, and be content with your wages, Luke 3. 14. Whither John by this answer held warring lawfull or allowed of, as most men pretend he did, I will not dispute it, neither does it belong to me in my place; Elias will
tell it you when he comes, him you may aske; But this good counsell and doctrine of St John, is no where better observed and followed then among the Souldiers under the Lyon which carryeth the Sword and Arrowes, therefore is he the more blessed and will finde the first mercy among or before all others for to enter into Gods kingdome; for as wee deale with others, so wee shall be dealt withall, and wherewith one sinneth, therewith shall he be punished, Wisdome 11. 17. Isaiah 33. How can any man justifie that which his owne Conscience condemneth him for, unlesse that a man would willfully bring a judgement upon his owne head, Isa: 6. 20. Rom: 2. therefore doe not erre; God will not be mocked, Gal: 6. 7. But if the Lyon with the sword and arrowes should feele the Collicke in his Body, he will hardly finde a Physition to Cure him, neither would Purge or Clyster helpe, which I am much afraid of, for when the arrowes are, then the sword will sinke also: Though men labour very much to Justifie Warre, however it seemes they will be sensible that the Warre produceth no good, and begin to cry, Nulla salus Bello, Pacem te possimus omnes; But it is too late, they should have sung this song sooner, for peace is taken away from the earth, they must destroy one another, Revel: 6. 4. and the sentence holds which stands in Genesis 9. 6. Hee that sheds mans blood, his blood shall be shed againe through man; the Reason is, because man is Created after Gods Image; Therefore he that disfigureth his Image, disfigureth Gods Image, his owne, and such a one sinneth in a threefold manner, and will hardly be excused; what a heavy sinne is it to shed mans blood, none knowes it but he alone which considereth that wee are dearly bought and redeemed through the blood of the Sonne of God, and this is the Reason why the eating of blood is forbidden as well in the New as in the old Testament, Act. 15. 29. Chap: 21. 25. Gen: 9. 4. Levit: 7. 26, 27. because wee are redeemed and bought by blood, wherefore it should be holy unto us in remembrance of our Redemption, Levit: 17. 14. for life is in the Blood, now what God hath sanctifyed no man ought to prophane, Act: 10. 15. He that knows it better let him, but hee must answer it to the holy Ghost who hath commanded it so, Acts 15. 29. But because Souldiers say, when wee cannot get our pay, wee are then forced to plunder? Answer, John the Baptist had nothing to doe with such Souldiers, neither can he impart any Councell to them, therefore they must goe some where else, namely, to the false
Prophets which seduceth the beast, and to his Consorts, to the other false Prophets which entice the Kings of the earth to fight, they may read their Nativity, Revel: 16. 13, 14: It is horrible to heare such false Prophets Pray to God, namely, to their God whom they serve as their Father, John 8 44. to grant his blessing that many thousands may be slaine, when it is done then goe to the Temple and sing to their God a Te Deum Laudamus, and intreat him to continue such blessings; The adverse party doe the like, which of them be the best, judge yee? However that they may have a Remedy, there is another John who sayth in his first Epistle Chap: 3. 15. Whosoever hateth his brother is a murtherer, and from the evill one, and moreover he sayes, Who is a murtherer of men, and yee know that no murtherer hath eternall life abiding in him; now if he be a murtherer that hateth his brother, much more if he be such a one that killeth his Neighbour with his hand; Let every one judge as he pleaseth, I am not a Judge though I announce Judgement, but I am onely a Watchman that performeth his Masters will. But I cannot set any other Prognostication for Souldiers then I have seene and knowne it in the Propheticall Astrology, namely, that all Warres with their furious and bloody accoutrements shall be burnt and consumed with fire. Isa: 9. 5. Psal: 46. 10. therefore the time will come very shortly in which the swords shall be turned into plough-shares, and their speares into pruning hookes, Isa: 2 Micah 4. but it must be first the contrary, plough-shares must be turned into swords, and pruining hookes must be turned into speares, it is practised now, they take them away from the ploughs, for the weeds must be gathered as it is written, Math: 13. 40, 41, 42. because the Harvest commeth, the great Corne-harvest and vintage, Revel: 14. Joel 3. 13, 14. and the heavy day of the Lord, of which Read Isaiah 13. Joel 2. and here and there in the Prophets; Therefore when the joyfull comming of the Lord shall be, then wee shall have a true and firme peace, and not before that time, let every man make his account accordingly. The greatest Calamities, Warres, and shedding of blood, all is to come yet, and neere at hand, many unheard of strange and severall plagues and miseries are comming, great famines, pestilence and dearth, and yet will soone passe over, and in such heavy calamities God will provide for his owne that feare him and call upon his Name, these shall be delivered, as it is promised, Mal: 3. 16, 17, 18. Chap: 4. And as wee have made
mention above in the Preface of those that have the Seale of God in their forehead, Revel: 7. 3. Now all those which are concerned herein in the abomination of desolation, which vexe, torment, and plague poore people with contribution and strayning, and such like wayes, especially if they seeke their owne profit, thereby they not onely onerate themselves with great sinnes by their Tyranny, but they participate also of other mens sinnes, and bring on their owne heads a double judgement and heavy damnation, because by their sucking extortion they eate up and devoure the poore people, Micah 3. Hab: 2. 6. Amos 5. 11, 12.
