They have away their Reward, and must expect Judgement without mercy; but he that sheweth mercy to his neighbour shall obtaine mercy againe, and he that is peaceable shall possesse the kingdome of God, and be called the childe of God, Math: 5. 7, 8. Luke 6. 36. Therefore though one have an ill ascendent and a bad Nativity, yet he may put away this evill ascendent, and give way for another ascendent, otherwise what should the Scripture avayle us, if wee should subdue an Ill Ascendent, which ascendents the Evill Spirit in man worketh, and not the naturall Astralls above in the Firmament, which onely shew what Ascendent there is in us, of which yee Astrologers nere take notice; What manner of nativity would you have sett for the Theife on the Crosse? Thus a man that stands in the new Birth and walketh with God, and God in him, needs not be affrayd at all of the signes in heaven, Jere: 10. 2. For he hath another ascendent in him which is the Spirit of Christ, Rom: 8. Therefore the true Astrology consisteth in the consideration of the Astralls and of the Spirit which man inwardly hath in himselfe, and by no meanes in the visible Astralls and heaven, and you are farre wide from knowing the true Astrology, neither the visible or invisible else you would make other Prognostications, however Judgement doth not belong to mee but to the Spirit of Judgement, and hee that hath that Spirit namely, of Elias, that is of the Lords.

div.head: The Eighth Chapter. What manner of Nativity and Prognostication is sett for the great whore of Babylon, and her Merchants, and those that went awhoring with her?
div.p:
TO this answers the Prophet Isaiah, Chap: 13. namely, Come downe to the dust thou Virgin Daughter Babylon, Chap: 47. her Prognostication is read also in Jeremy 51. And that a people will come from the North and shall make her Land desolate; whether it be done yet? Therefore when Babylon shall fall and falleth, then the Children of Israel and the Children of Juda will come together weeping, they will make hast, and to seeke the Lord their God they will enquire after the way to Sion, and set their faces that way, and will be joyned with the Lord in an eternall Covenant which shall never be broken. What manner a one is that Babylon, who can tell it us which is alwayes so much threatned, Jere: 51. The Spirit of prophesie describeth her, Revel: 17. she sits on many waters, and that the Kings of the Earth have committed fornication with her, and are made drunke with the wine of her whoredome: the Spirit sayth further, shee sitteth on a scarlet Red Beast, full of blasphemies, having seaven heads and ten hornes, and truely this woman is sufficiently set forth but because it is added that it is a mystery I also may let it stand so till Elias commeth, he will teach us at last; the Spirit sayth, The woman which thou hast seene is the great Citty that hath the Dominion over the Kings of the Earth, as I conceive it should be the false Christendome in its Carnal sects: I am of opinion that wee should not looke on the external Citty, but on the great Citty, that is, nor on the visible structure of houses, but on the whole Empire, which happily is the great Citty, called Babylon, and this Empire or the Woman which boasteth that shee is chast and not a whore, but God will discover her shame, so that her whoredome shall be knowne to all the world, and the ten Kings which have committed whoredome with her, will hate her and make
her desolate, and burne her with fire, and give her kingdome to the Beast till the words of God be accomplished.

Now whether these ten Kings have already begunne to hate the whore and to lay her waste you may judge, for from heenceforth she shall be still consumed with the fire of the fierce wrath of God both spiritually and bodily, therefore I am of opinion that the great whore of Babylon, is not onely an externall kingdome, but also a spirituall Woman, and that she is the whore Jezabel, which sayth that shee is a Prophetesse, and seduceth the servants of God to commit spirituall whoredome, and to eate of the offerings unto Idols, and so I conceive to be the Woman the wicked Doctrine of which the Prophet speaketh, Zacha: 5. and the whore, of which Solomon speaketh in his Proverbs, that shee inticeth young men to court and play with he, now there is a Prognostication set, Revel: 2. 20, 21, 22. &c. viz: that the Lord will cast her on the bed of affliction, and her Adulterers also, if they doe not turne from their workes and kill her Children, therefore wee acknowledge a twofold Babylonian whore, namely, a spirituall and a worldly one, the one shall be judged with the bodyly sword, and the other with the sword of the Spirit. And that wee may better learne to know the great Babylon, and to take notice by her names, what manner of ones shee hath; shee is called Babel, a confusion, namely, where the tongues and languages are mixed, where the one cannot understand what the other sayth, nor these two, what the third sayth, and these three cannot understand what the fourth sayth, or what he meaneth, and so they are confounded, nay quite scattered, and at last it is come so farre, so that they have not onely disputed and argued one with another a long time, warring one against another, destroying, laying waste and rooting up one another, farre worse then the great Babylon; Behold thus have I seene it upon my Watch Tower, and so I tell you of it, happily you may see it as well if you are not blinde yee watchmen on the Tower, Isa 56. 10. What doe you thinke now what kinde of people this must be of Babel, that wicked great whore, who hath caused all that tumult and stirre like yonder whore Jezabel, yet shee paynteth and adorneth her selfe with this and with that, and is hanged about with purple and scarlet, gilded over with gold, Jewells and pearles of the holy Scripture, nay quite with a divine nature, and kingly generation with the Fathers, Symbolls and Councells; for thus I have seene her, and as shee was
shewed unto me so I relate unto you of her, and you will not take it ill of me, and shee hath a Golden Cup in her hand, which is fayre, and all of Gold on the outside, so shee seemes to be, Math: 7. 25. 2 Corinth: 11. 13, 14. but within it is full of abomination and uncleannesse of her whoredome, and is distinct from the Cup of the Prophet Esdras as poyson and physicke is, 4 Esdras 14. 39. And that you may the better understand what manner of drinke there is in the Cup of the great Babylonian whore, therefore read Collos: 2. 8. James 3. 14, 15. and drinke no more out of it, but goe to him that calleth you to the Drinke and Water of Life, Isaiah 55. Jere: 2. 13. John 4. 14. Psal: 36. 10. for death and poyson is in the Cup of the great Whore, which is the Heathenish Phylosophy, Animalish Theology and perversnesse in the Civill Law; now out of the Cup of this great Babylonian whore have drunke all Kings and Heathens, and are made so drunke that they reele and fall destroying one another, and lay the whore waste and desolate, thus it is so, and all the World is inebriated with it, therefore doth shee stirre so much also, shee tumbleth, reeleth and falls, Jerem: 51. 7. and it is not yet come to the full ripenesse, as you shall feele it by woefull experience

Now the Merchants are much perplext at this fall of Babylon, they beginne already to weepe, lament, and howle, which they have done a long time also, and seeke for Remedy here and there, whether Babel might be cured, and to heale the soare, and have fetcht severall playsters, salves, and sweedes, and apply it to the soare, to try whether it may be healed, but it still growes worse, therefore they say wee applyed Cures to Babylon, but shee is not healed, wee will leave her, and let every one returne home, for her judgement is come, exalted to heaven and to the Clouds, Jerem: 51. 9. Revel: 18. 5. Therefore Babel cannot be cured with any salve, playster, and swede, for shee hath the French disease, and hath a soare which eateth and corrodeth every part about her, that will suddenly make an end of her; Now seeing that Babel the great Citie hath inebriated all the Heathens of her Cup, therefore shee must be punisht therewith, wherewith shee hath sinned, namely, both thee and all those that have committed whoredome with her, must now also drinke of the Cup which the Lord hath in his hand, and giveth of it to drinke to all Kings and Heathens, Jere: 25. 15. and Babel also must drinke, Revel: 16. 19. for the Judgement commeth in which the Cup goeth
about, and of which all wee must drinke even the House of God, and the Citie of God, where the Judgement began, Jerem: 25. 39. 1 Pet: 4. 17. but the wicked must drinke of the dreggs and perish thereof, Psal: 75. 9. This is the generall Prognostication over all the Inhabitants of the earth, viz: that the Judgement commeth, here now is no other Remedy but as the Apostle sayth, 1 Cor: 11. 31. Acts 3. 19. Seeing Babel must fall be shee never so much underpropped, because her time is come, namely, the great Citie which remaineth over the Kings on the earth, which is not onely the Citie Rome, but rather the whole Empire; therefore her Merchants will howle the more here and there and in all places, that her wares will sell no more, and there will be none that will buy them both spiritual and temporal, especially being false wares and not true Gold and pearles wherewith the Whore hath deckt her selfe as it shall be manifest, for I have seene a Refiner comming which melteth and refineth the Gold and the Silver of the Babylonians with the sharpest proofe in the fire through Antymony, there it went away altogether with the Antymony, read of it Mal: 3. 3. He hath brought also the Babylonian garments to the fire, even as the pure incombastible garment is purged, all is consumed also; Therefore I advise you that you goe out from Babel, and from her Merchants, and buy other more approved Gold and Garment of him who adviseth and warneth us least wee be burnt with fire, with the great whore, Revel: 3. 18. Chap: 18. 4. Hee that hath eares let him heare.

div.head: The Ninth Chapter. What manner of Prognostication and Nativity is sett for Shepherds and Watchmen, which watch over the fold and flocke, what shall befall them?
div.p:
SEeing these men are learned and handle the Scripture, and have with the Pope the keyes to the kingdome of heaven, and have power to open heaven, and shutt it againe, as they suppose, and may save, condemne, and excommunicate men as they beleive, I would
not willingly intangle or trouble my selfe with them, however I must discharge my selfe in my office, least I should be found treacherous to him that hath sett me in the Tower to keepe Watch, and whereas I am a Watchman amongst others, I hope they will excuse me, and I will be very circumspect to speake nothing without Scripture, and nothing but what I have discovered on the Tower. If I consider well the Prognostication and Nativity of these watchmen, I finde and observe that they have not all one ascendent, and every one hath a peculiar or singular Wind in the Head, which is plaine in that, because they are thus scattered more then those at Corinth, 1 Cor: 3. 4. Besides there are so many schysmes, so that every one would clime to be a Pope, for the Pope's Ascendent, transcendeth the rest; but I feare the Popes Descendent is come equally with the Popes upon them, Isa: 4. 7. because Elias commeth 1 Kings 18. 18. read the whole Chapter; But if I shall speake of their Nativity, it is found that they are blind and know nothing which is the true Religion, and even the Angel of the Church at Laodicea, Revel: 3. 17. which boasteth highly and are so blinde that all the visions of the Prophets are to them as a word of a sealed booke, which if it be given to one for to read it, he replyeth I cannot, for it is sealed, or as if it were given to one that cannot read it, why? because the Lord hath filled to you a spirit, a hard sleepe, and hath shutt your eyes, he hath blinded your Prophets & Princes, together with the Seers, Isa: 29. 9, 10. 11, and 12. The Shepherds are become fooles and care not for the Lord, which is the Reason why they can teach no sound Doctrine, all the flockes are scattered, read what the Lord speaketh of the Prophet, Jere: 23. it is a hard Prognostication but it is very true, it is much if it be well considered, all Heards are scattered, for the one is this, the other is that, the one hath or is of such a faith and Religion, which is in the right, and which is in the wrong? Math: 24. 23, 24, 25. Luke 17. 23. and who shall determine it? Christ the true Shepherd and righteous Judge sayth Luke 18. 8. Doest thou thinke that the Sonne of man will finde faith on Earth at his comming? What doe you thinke of this saying, surely they may make ones hayre stand staring upright, nay the Lord sayth yet more, Math: 24. 24. If it were possible the very Elect may be seduced unto Errors; But that holds still; Who beleiveth our preaching, and to whom is the Arme of the Lord now knowne? Isaiah 53. Now because no man dareth to give the Lord
the lye, therefore the Word of God standeth firme and holds, as it is written, God is onely true and all men are lyars, amongst whom I count my selfe engeniously to be the greatest, Rom: 3. 4. least any should thinke I counted my selfe more righteous then other men are. What will become of all these severall and various Religions and disputings, may it not be learned and knowne? Yes, for I see one comming in the forme and similitude of a Prophet, having a Scepter in his hand, and a two edged sword girt by his side, out of his mouth commeth a consuming fiery Flame; having an open book in his left hand, he goeth to this great multitude that have worshipped the golden Calfe, saying with a loud and great voyce, Come hither to me yee that belong to the Lord, there gathered unto him the Children of Levi, which are spoken of, Mala: 3. 3. who are purifyed by the melter and refiner, and he sayd, Girt every man his sword by his side, and goe in and out from gate to gate throughout the Campe, and slay every man his brother, and every man his companion, and every man his Neighbour, and the Children of Levi did according to the word of Moses, and there fell of the people that day about three thousand Men, Exod: 32. 25. &c. What signifyeth this vision? Remember yee the Law of Moses my servant, which I commanded unto him in Horeb for all Israel the statutes and judgements, Mala: 4. 4. Now because I have seene all this on my Guard and on the Mount, therefore I must Prognosticate Warre and the sword to you Shepherds and Watchmen, namely, the sword of the Lord, which shall warre with you, and this sword is called the word of God, which you much boast of, of which you may read, Revel: 2. 16. Chap: 16. 1. Chap: 19. 13. 15. Heb: 4. 12. and that you may yet better understand it, Read, Ephes: 6. 17. 2 Thess: 2. 8. Isaiah 11. 4. Zach: 4. 6. Now if you joyntly in your Multitude can defend your selves against one Man, you may try, I feare you are not able, the Reason is, because you doe not agree amongst your selves, you are too much divided, and so you are the easier overcome, and yee are not able to stand against that one; Therefore I have seene one comming from or in the North, whose comming out is from the East, on which is written the name of the Lord, which is called Elias, he knoweth not your Names, and beareth the Name of the Lord in his mouth, he was compassed with all manner of sects which he cut in peices in the name of the Lord, Psal: 118. and trampled the Saganim under foote, even as a Potter treadeth his Loame, Isaiah 41. 25. And I
have seene also that the Lord hath trod Satan under his feete, and no man could hinder it; I have seene also that three Greyhounds which belonged to the Hangman, rann all at him to teare him in peices, but God tooke him up on high in a moment, even when the Hounds snatcht at him; and I saw three other Doggs stand before him, which fayne would have had a fling at him, but he had an Axe in his hand which frighted the Doggs away, and a flocke of sheepe stood before him which he was to feed.

What other Prognostication shall I shew unto you Shepherds, but that you also must drinke of the Cup, of which Jere: 25. prophesied; for thus sayth the Lord, ver: 34. Howle yee Shepherds, and Cry and wallow your selves in the ashes yee chiefe of the flocke; for the dayes of your slaughter and of your dispersions are accomplished, and yee shall fall like a precious vessell, and the Shepherds shall have no way to flee, nor the principal of the flocke to escape; a voyce of the Cry of the Shepherds, and an howling of the cheife of the Flocke shall be heard, for the Lord hath spoyled their pasture, and the peaceable inhabitants are cutt downe because of the fierce Anger of the Lord. Hee hath forsaken his Covert, as the Lyon, for their Land is desolate because of the oppressour, and because of his fierce anger. What doe yee thinke yee Shepherds, have you found any of it come to passe? All is nothing to that which is yet to come; for now commeth the sword of the Spirit which separateth soule and spirit, he with his Anatomizing will make such a section by the Anatomist, that all shall be discovered, and nothing shall be covered, and indeed with such a Revelation the like thereof was never done, since the world was created, and never the like shall be done any more, Heb: 4. 12, 13. Remember the Act and the sword of the great Prophet Elias, 1 Kings 18. none shall escape this two edged sword, let him be mounted as high as he will, though he be as high as the Pope at Rome, yet the time is come that he which exalted himselfe so high, and hath even seated himselfe in Gods place must come downe, all hills and Mountaines shall be humbled and levelled, and the vallyes shall be exalted, Isaiah 2. 40. Rugged, rough and uneven things shall be layd flatt and made plaine, because he commeth which shall bring all things to Right, and the glory of the Lord shall be revealed, that all flesh shall see that the Mouth of the Lord speaketh, Isaiah 52. 6. What will come out of it at the last? that which is written, Math: 24. 14. of which more hath been spoken
above, viz. The Lord himselfe will take care of his flocke, and require them at their hands, and will visit his sheep in grace and mercy, and will give to them onely one Shepherd, which shall make one fold out of Christians and Jewes, Chap: 37. 16. Read this Chapter unto the end. And wee all shall have one onely Shepherd, namely, that good Shepherd, who hath layd downe his life for his sheepe, and he will gather all the flockes into one fold, and seperate the Goates from the sheepe on the day of Judgement, and give unto them their Reward, and there will be one flocke and one Shepherd, John 10. This joyfull good newes and happy Prognostication should stirre us up to be glad and cheerefull, and render thankes unto the Lord, because the time is now come in which he will gather his faithfull and select people from the foure Winds, and from the End of the Earth, through the shrill trumpet of the Gospel of the kingdome, Math: 24. 14. 31. Then the righteous shall shine like the Sunne in the kingdome of their father, Chap: 13. 43. He that hath eares to heare let him heare.

div.head: The Tenth Chapter. What kinde of Prognosticke and Nativity shall be sett for Ʋniversities, and other Schooles, for Doctors, Chayre-men, Masters, Students, Writers, Printers, Stationers?
div.p:
IT is to be admired what Nativity the Apostle appropriateth to such men when he sayth, 1 Tim. 1. 5, 6, 7. The end and scope of the Commandement is, Charity, out of a pure heart and a good Conscience, and of fayth unfayned; whereas some of them have erred, they turned to unprofitable Babling, they will be teachers of the Scripture, and yet understand not what they say, nor what they should hold, or confirme; that is to say, themselves know not whether it be right or wrong, true or false, and so dispute still about it, even to this time, and their day for disputing is Saterday or Sunnes Eve, if they knew it, what need to dispute about it, why they doe not keepe to the summe held forth by the Apostle in this now quoted
place? Therefore the Apostle sayth againe, 2 Tim: 3. 7. They are alwayes learning, and cannot attaine unto the knowledge of truth, nay they rather oppose the truth, like as Jannes and Jambres withstood Moses, and they are such men who are corrupt in their understanding, and cannot examine saith neither doe they know what true Faith and Religion is, and yet will never leave off disputing, every one thinking himselfe in the right; but they shall proceed no further, for their folly shall be revealed to all, even as the others were made knowne unto the world; This is one thing which is prognosticated unto them, namely, that their foolishnesse shall be publickly made knowne, and indeed not long ester these dayes; for I have seene this Revelation with my eyes on my watch Tower, and indeed to speake it in one word, because they doe not know themselves, and doe not know once what man is, and so as I conjecture it will befall them as it did Nicodemus, who was a cheife Ruler and Master in Israel, who understood not earthly matters, what should he know of the heavenly things! John 3. Nay if there were but so much goodnesse in them as to come with Nicodemus to Christ by night, and conferre with the onely Master about matters. Now because they cannot agree among themselves, and their senses are scattered, in Theologicall as well as Philosophicall matters, and yet still dispute whether Logick be an Ens, an Art, an habit, &c. and it is manifest also in themselves that they belong to Babel, therefore the Nativity and Prognosticke of the great whore of Babylon will light upon them also: and it is needlesse to make any great dispute about it, for the appells doe not fall farre off from the Tree, and this is our naturall principle, namely, from whence a thing commeth, thither it returnes; This Maxime alone exceeds farre and is more Real then their whole Aristotle, then all their Physicks and Metaphysicks, and all their Philosophy, would to God that all they both Philosophers and Divines might but observe this one Axioma, they would learne more in one moment, then they have learned in many hundred and thousand yeares, from hence generally proceeds all Ignorance, because they have no principles, neither have they seene or knowne what thing a Principle is; seeing they have not true principles neither in the one nor in the other Faculty or Profession, or what you may call it; Therefore themselves know not from whence they are, and whither they returne, in regard they are ignorant of this Maxim or Theorema (to wit) from whence a
thing is, thither it returneth; to this Axiome of Wisdome, viz: from whence a thing is, thither it returneth, the onely Master hath proposed unto us John 3. and there also John the Baptist; God knoweth that I wish it from the bottome of my heart, that you all might observe it well, and consider it diligently, and meditate onely on this word, then you might easily be helped, and you would not have need hereafter to make use of Bookes in your Studyes, in all your faculties, onely this one, which is the Word of God; I would not have you thinke that I despise you, or doe not wish you well, God forbid but I doe it for your good, I would not that you should run on any further into perdition. Therefore I give to you a faithfull warning, according to the duty of my place, and I am commanded as a Watchman so to doe; for the word is, To the Law and to the Testimony; ought not the people to aske and inquire of his God? Isaiah 8. 19, 20. But now your Wisdome is not from above, and out of God, but from below, and out of the flesh, of which you may read, James 3. 14, 15. Not because I say it, but that I have thus seene and heard it of him that commeth after me, of whom I am not worthy to make cleane the shooes of one of his Prophets; Tomorrow is the Sun-day Judica, where wee read in the Gospel for that day, that Christ sayth John 8. 46, 47. If I tell you the truth, why doe you not beleive me? He that is of God heareth Gods word; It may well be called Judica, for there is a mighty heavy Judgement comming even over you, Universities, Doctors, Chayre-men, Readers, and over all that belongeth thereunto this I tell you; therefore judge once a righteous Judgement, and no more after the authority of men John 7. 24. Perhaps God may be gracious unto you, but all ignorance commeth from thence, because the Word of God is not regarded, and you thinke not that any Physicks can be learned in the Bible, of which it doth so abound, even as a Fountaine which springeth continually as well in the New as in the old Testament if wee had onely eyes to see and to draw the Water, and the Lying Spirit hath perswaded these book-men, that, that, which is true in Phylosophy, to be false in Theology, and that which is true in Theology does not hold in Phylosophy it is truer, namely, in your Phylosophy, and your Theology; Quae qualis quanta sit, qui post me venit vobis monstrabit. Yee Book-men, what have yee acted and driven on one among another so many hundred and thousand yeares with all your Preaching, Reading, Teaching Crying and
Scribling, and you have filled the World full of Bookes, which are endlesse and numberlesse, nothing else but that you thereby are more and more scattered, confused, and intricated; and this is the Prognosticke upon all your Bookes which wee Read Acts 19. 19. Namely, your Shop will be burnt with fire, both bodily and spiritually. Then the shopmen of Babel shall howle weepe, and lament, Revel: 18. 8. 11. because no body will buy their wares any more. How doe you like this Prognosticke you Letter-Casters, Compositers, Setters, Printers and Stationers; and indeed the Scripture sayth, all this shall come to passe in one Day and in one houre, Revel: 18. 17. 19. Now I know full well that you will not beleive it, but you will finde it too true, and sooner then you looke for, especially when the Gospel of the kingdome shall be preached all the world over. True there are many scorners, mockers and despisers in the world, even so were they from the beginning, and every one is secure; there is no end of Building and Planting, of Marrying and Dancing, of selling and buying, of gormandizing and Tipling, because the prophesie of Christ must be fullfilled Luke 17. 26. &c. and he that speaketh of it is mocked and derided and despised for it; therefore it will come upon them, as it is written in their Prognosticke, Mala: 4. Isaiah 28. What will become of it seeing all this buisnesse of Bookmen shall goe to wrack come to an end, and shall be burnt with fire, Namely, this will come of it, the Bookes which hitherto have been sealed shall be opened, and those which hitherto have been open, shall be shutt, of which read, Isaiah 33. 4. 4 Esdras 6. 20. Revel: 6. 12, 13, 14. And properly the true meaning of it is this, That wee shall be all taught of God, and none shall teach the other any more, and say, Know the Lord, for they shall all know him, from the least to the greatest, because God will powre forth his Spirit upon all flesh, and write his Law in our hearts and be gracious unto us all, and then the whole Earth also will be filled with the knowledge of God, of this you may read, Isaiah 11. 9. Chap: 29 24. and 32. 4. and 35. 8. and 52. 6. and 54. 13. Jere: 2. 15, Chap: 24. 7. and 31. 33, 34. Ezek: 36. 25, 26, 27. Item 11. 19. Jere: 32. 29. Joel 2. 28. Zacha: 12. 10.

Who would not rejoyce from the bottome of his heart because there is such a happinesse at hand which all shall enjoy, the children of God, and all those which call upon the Name of the Lord, and all those which goe out from Babel, and those that confesse and acknowledge
their blindnesse, darknesse, and sinne, and pray to God for Grace and illumination, as I being warned and taught of God have done and that one may be taught gratis, not to spend a penny on it, when hitherto so great expences were made for to be learned, and to goe to this and that Schoole for it whereas now a body may sit at home, set not one foote out of Doores, Isai: 55. Rom: 10. 6, 7, 8. Luke 17. 21. 23. Therefore be advised Laodicea, that you also may be helped, Revel: 3. 4. &c. Therefore he that will heare let him heare.

div.head: The Eleventh Chapter. What shall be Prognosticated for Physitians and Surgeons, Apothecaries, and Chymists, Miners, and the like.
div.p:
TO what miseries, calamities, and lamentable distractions mans life is subject unto, even from the Mothers wombe to the Grave, none knoweth better then poore sicke and weakly men, for which are ordained Physitians, Apothecaries, and such like, and there is no calling and profession on Earth which is more necessary and usefull for man, next unto the Apostolicke and propheticall vocation, then Physicke, and if one had all the world, and were neither happy nor healthy, what would it profit a man, and this profession hath a good Testimony, not onely in the holy Scripture, Exod: 13. 26. Syrach 38 1, 2. &c. but also in the experience, be it what it will; The Physitians will also have an End, so will their Apothecaries, Surgeons, and the like, have a Rest from their cares and paines, And let them take this for their Prognostication, from my watch Tower that I have heard, but not yet seene, namely, that there shall come such an universall Medicine, which not onely cureth all diseases, and preserveth health, but shall take Death quite away, and swallow him eternally, what could a man wish for more in this world then for this; Because Death raigneth over all, although Christ dyed, arose againe, and ascended into heaven, and sitteth at the right hand of God, what was it to poore men at the
Time of Christ and his Apostles, that they were delivered by them from so many infirmities, and healed of them? Christ his Apostles and Prophets had this profession, and therefore it is more worthy then others, and is next to the Propheticall calling, and one might wonder why uncivill Lawyers should take the upper hand of Physitians, doe these unexpert men not know that health is better then Riches and Goods? But that you might not thinke as if I had told a Fable concerning the universall Medicine, you shall understand my Prognosticke thus of the Right and true universall Medicine, which will be not onely for man, but for all flesh, namely, there stands a Tree, and it is in Paradize, which is called the Tree of Life, which shall be revealed and made knowne at the glorious and joyfull comming of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ, whose fruit shall be plucked and eaten, whereby all men and all flesh shall be delivered and freed from death, and that so really and fundamentally and certainly, as really as at the Beginning of the fall into sinne through the plucking of the forbidden fruite and the eating thereof, wee and all flesh are fallen into sinne and Death, and are come into all misery and necessity. Now God hath reserved this glory and transcendent Joy for us the last, and reserved the good Wine till now, even at these our times, all and what hitherto hath been concealed shall be revealed, be it never so secret and mysticall, so now also shall the way to the Tree of Life be Revealed, which time the Apostle Peter calls the times of Refreshings from the presence of the Lord, and the times of Restitution, all what was lost or taken away in Paradize, Acts 3. 19, 20, 21. At which the Prophet Daniel poynteth, Chap 9. 24. Wee read of the great Apostle, how he was Ravished into Paradize, where he heard unspeakeable words, which is not lawfull for a man to speake, Of such a one I will glory, saith he, 2 Corinth: 12. 4. What words should these be? I poore wretch am farre inferior to St Paul, and why should any thought come into my heart as to know what it was, however in the feare of the Lord I may very well say, that this which I shall tell I have heard of the glory of the Children of God which is revealed unto me, of the which all other creatures with us shall pertake, which hitherto have waited for with a longing and sighing desire, Rom: 8. ver: 19, 20, 21. Read also 4 Esdras 7. v: 53. Chap: 8. v: 52, 53, 54. But when Elias commeth who was with Christ on the Mount, he shall speake to you more of it. Now wee tell you thus as wee have heard of the
Tree of Life, which hitherto was sealed, and no man either durst or could breake that seale, because a fiery Mountaine lyeth before it, which shall not be removed unlesse Christ come with great power and glory, of whose comming wee speake to you that it is nearer at hand then is beleived of men. Being it is so therefore I have such a Prognostication to all Physitians that their Medicines will be worth nothing then, because another Garden is found out, of which shall and may be gathered and fetched not onely the hearb unto health, but against the very death also, who should not rejoyce for you also shall be made partaker of it, if you accept of and beleive it, and my Prognostication be not contrary and against you.

Moreover, let the Chymists know and have this prognosticke from Me, namely, that the Philosophers Stone, wherewith they have cured the sicke, their universall and highest Medicine will be worth nothing then neither, and is farre inferior to this universall Medicine, of which I have heard and doe tell you of it, and will be more inferior, then Water in respect of the other; What doe you thinke of it you that prate so much of Chymicke Matters, and have written so many bookes of it, and have perplexed and involved many therewith? I doe not speake of the true and solid Alchymists, who besides are found Good Christians, but the sadlers and quacks which however were serviceable to their neighbour with a plaine singlenesse of heart; As Fryer Basilius Valentinus, Theophrastus, and others, these also shall heare this Word, I have been sicke and you have visited me, and looked not alwayes for your fee and pay, as such Money-Physitians for the most part doe, and forget Mercy and Love, and are not Samaritans; Therefore you Alchymists must know, that all your glory will have an end as well of the universall Medicine as of the projection & transmutation of Mettalls inferior, to turne them into Gold or Silver, and this out of the Earth. Glory shall come to Miners that they will bring in the new World out of the Earth, more Gold and Silver then there will be need or use for, and that shall be cleare and pure and compact not needing to be melted or refined, or have you not read the Prognostication of it, Isaîah 60. 17. No man is able to beleive what transcendent and superabundant Treasures and Riches in the Mountaines doe lye hid, nay plainly on the earth, and on the Acres, and the feilds of Gold and Silver and pretious Stones, which hitherto was hidden and sealed till the last time, in which all shall be Revealed unto the praise
of God, but what is that on the earth in respect of that which is in Paradice, and what is that in Paradice in comparison to that glory which is in the divine World? for there is a thing more noble and higher then the Tree of Life in Paradice, namely, the Stone which the Builders hitherto have rejected, Psal: 118. Many will thinke now whither will this goe at last, If I knew onely to make the Phylosophers Stone, or where these Treasures lye hid, of which you speake, I could willingly leave the other subtill speculations unto thee, not to he that seeketh meerely corruptible things will perish with them, this is a true Prognostication, 1 John 2. 17. But he that seeketh before all things, the kingdome of God, him God will seeke also, and make him rich eternally, therefore I doe wish from the bottome of my heart, that all yee were minded as I am, then wee should soone grow and be rich, and inrich others also, I desire no more then from hand to mouth, with my small number I could be rich easily and be in great respect before the World, if I would but worship their God, of which I say thus, Get thee hence Satan, and who should thinke that I should not have a six pence to bestow it on a Fish, and to eate it with my Children, which I first must goe and borrow it; O man! if thou didst but know the superabundant Riches of the knowledge of Christ Jesus, and of his kingdome and glory, surely thou wouldst say to this World, its Riches and glory; Fye on thee, and Remember what St Paul sayth, Phil: 3. 7, 8. But now oh man this glory is revealed unto thee, and that gratis, for nothing, you need not give any thing for it, and the Gospel of the kingdome shall be preached in all the world, to all Nations meerely gratis, it is well for him which acknowledges it, and accepteth of the same thankfully, but he that despiseth and rejecteth it, shall in like manner be rejected and despised.

div.head: The Twelfth Chapter. What shall be Prognosticated to the Politicians, Lawyers, Civilians, all rich wicked and unrighteous persons, effeminate men, and the like?
div.p: THe great difference among men and the sonnes of men, must be observed not onely by their names, but rather by their actions, otherwise wee shall be deceived by their gay garments, and Sheeps-cloaths. Now these Sheeps-cloaths are so common now adayes that wee can hardly know to whom it should belong and be fitting to weare, yet Christ ascribeth the same to the false Prophets, Math: 7. 15. and warneth us that wee should take heed and beware of them, Math: 7. 15. But the Foxes furred Coate Christ applyed to King Herod, Luk: 13 32. Thereby ought wee to observe what Nativity is due to the Politicians, Lawyers, and the like persons. Now the sheepe, a plaine simple silly harmlesse beast, which taketh paines for his food, and is contented with a little, and is to be admired, no untowardnesse in it, however it hath three shrewd Enemies, The Lyon, the Wolfe, and the Dogge, or the Lyon Beare, and Wolfe. The sheepe is an Emblem of a poore domesticke state or Husbandman, he must seeke for his bread in the sweat of his browes, but cannot quietly enjoy it, but is tormented and plagued, especially at these times, in so much that he very well might wish himselfe out of the world, however Deliverance is not farre off, however there are yet two if not three stormy tempestuous seasons at hand.

Now there are severall beasts which teare poore men in peices, and are ready to devoure them quite, and lye in waite in their denns for them; such fellows Nativities are exprest in the 10th Psalme; among these severall Beasts are the Herodian Foxes, the Politicians, Civilians, Lawyers, these are those Foxes, they can be no otherwise named, then Christ and the holy Scripture termed them,
so that a Fox and they stand together in one predicament, for all crafts, daubing, cunningnesse is concenterated therein. Aesop in his Fables setts them out also; the Logicians Rule here holdeth, A Fox is a good Politician and Lawyer, and that a Politician and a Lawyer is a Fox, if it be not so commonly understood, yet it is felt the more. Wherein then does consist this so highly and largely out set Jurisprudentia and politia? doth there belong such a Volume to it; must there be so many Lawes? Answer; Whither wee be Heathens or Christians, it matters not; The judgement of these Lawes is this, Matth: 17. 12. What ever you would have done unto you, you must doe the same to another: Hee that does not practise this Rule is no good Lawyer, and is unworthy of the name; Now whereas unrighteousnesse hath prevailed too much, and Charitie is quite frozen, and Politicians and Lawyers care not for that stale Rule, although it stands stamped in their owne hearts and consciences, Rom: 2. 14, 15. but have and make new subtill inventions, therefore wee found a Prognostication for them also, Isaiah 10. 1, 2, 3, 4. it is thus, they also shall be destroyed, Item, Chap: 5. 20. They are called the Inventors of the Law, which turne Right into Gall, and the fruite of Righteousnesse into Wormewood, Amos 5. 7. and Chap: 6. 12. read the whole 5 and 6 Chapters: Thus is your whole Prognostication set downe, Wis: 6. A good Politician and a good Lawyer, are good Christians also, and be sought after as if they were Gods to give advice, to comfort and helpe, as it is written also, Psal: 8. 6. Exod: 22. 8. 28. Such Politicians and Lawyers will be made pertakers also of the kingdome of Christ and of his glory.

But what is Prognosticated to the Rich, which have gotten Riches by Covetousnesse (which with them is called Gods blessing) oppression, extorsion, &c. Amos 8. Isal: 5. 8. Thus speakes Saint James 5. v: 1. Goe to now yee rich men, weepe and howle for your miseries that shall come upon you; your Riches are corrupted, and your Garments moth-eaten; your Gold and Silver is cankered, and the Rust of them shall be a witnesse against you, and shall eate your flesh, as it were fire; you have reaped treasure together for the last dayes, &c. Therefore many of the Rich covetous men which hitherto have beene so secure, shall heare the voyce of God; Thou Foole, this night thy soule shall be taken away from thee, and then whose shall
all that be which thou hast so greedily gathered, Luk. 12. 20. Christ sayth, Chap: 6. 24. Woe unto you that are rich, for yee have received your consolation. Now as covetousnesse is the roote of all evill, so it shall receive also an ill reward, 1 Tim. 6. 10. and truely he that studyeth to be rich knitteth a snare for himselfe, or maketh a Roape to be hanged therewith, and pulled by into hell; as Judas Iscariot did; and in the 9th verse the Apostle calleth Riches a snare; and this Prognostication also is sett upon Rich men, that it is very difficult for a Rich man to enter into the kingdome of Heaven, Math: 19, 23, 24. for all that the whole world striveth to be Rich, and all men are greedy after moneys in their states, Isaiah 56. 11. Jerem: 6 13. and if a man be never so Rich, yet will he not say that he hath enough, but who is it that desireth to be Rich in God, Luke 12. 21. which Christ commanded wee should doe, Math: 6. 19, 20, 21. But who Beleiveth this word? But the Prognosticke of the poore is full of Comfort, for the kingdome of Heaven and Salvation is assigned for them, Math: 5. 3. Luke 6. 20. What manner of poore men? they are Rich in faith, saith the Scripture, James 2. 5. Christ describeth them, that they forsake all for his sake, Math: 19. 27. Mark: 10. 29, 30. Luke 14. 26. 33. Now those which choose rather to be poore in this world then to be Rich, they are Rich in faith, for they looke not on that which is visible, but on things invisible, though the world counteth it foolishnesse, 2 Corinth: 4. 18.

What shall wee say or Prognosticate for effeminate and voluptuous men, which fare deliciously and gallantly in this world? their Nativity is sett downe, Wisd: 2. and their Prognostication is in the 4th Chap: and besides the Scripture speakes plainely, 1 Cor: 6. 10. Ʋnrighteous men cannot inherit the kingdome of God, nor Theeves, nor Covetous, nor drunkards, nor Revilers, but if they purge themselves of all these things, repent sincerely, and feare God, and beleive the Gospel of the kingdome, then they may be saved, and inherit the kingdome of God. Now all these which love the world, eye pleasures, carnall lusts, and a proud life, shall not inherit the kingdome of God, this is their Prognostication, that as the things of this world doe perish, and at last the world also, so they also perish, 1 John 2. 16, 17. And where man hath his Treasure, there is his heart also, and as his Treasure is, so is his heart, Math: 6. 20,
21. viz: Either corruptible or incorruptible, earthly or heavenly, below on earth or above in heaven, and what every one seeketh or striveth for, the same he shall obtaine, and either will rejoyce in the same together, or else be eternally tormented, Collos: 3. 2. But wee doe not looke upon that which is visible and corruptible, but on that which is invisible and eternall, 2 Cor: 4. 18.

In the Closing of this our Prognostication, that every one may know what he shall doe in the last heavie troublesome dangerous times, to escape and avoyd all these miseries prognosticated in this Almanack, and enjoy all good promised therein, and may enter also into the kingdome of heaven. The Apostle giveth a direction hereunto, Acts 2. 38, 39. and Chap: 3. 19, 20, 21. that wee must repent to reject evill and choose the good, Deut: 30. 19. and that wee may easily know and conceive what manner of men these are to whom Christ assigneth and admitteth them to his kingdome, Matth: 25. 24. Namely, to those who fedd him in his members when they were hungry and thirsty, if it 'twas but a cup of cold water, it shall be rewarded, which is a singular moving word, Chap. 10. 42. Item those that have entertained and cloathed him when he was naked, and visited him in his sicknesse and imprisonment, but those which doe not so are rejected of Christ, therefore shew mercy and you shall receive mercy, Math: 5. 7. Luke 6. 36. therefore no other conclusion and sentence but this, Those that have done good shall enter into life, and those that have done evill shall enter into death and damnation, John 5. 29. for Judgement shall be kept answerable to every mans worke, Matth: 7. 21. Revel: 2. 23. Rom: 2. Therefore as man soweth, so shall he reape, be it good or bad, Gal: 6. 7, 8, 9, 10. And this is our generall Prognostication wherewith wee conclude,
div.q: Behold I come as a Theife in the Night, Blessed is he that watcheth and keepeth his Garments, that he walke not naked, and his nakednesse be seene.

closer.dateline: Finished through the grace and helpe of the Spirit, on Saturday before the Sunday of Judica being the 3d day of Aprill Anno 1647.

div.head: Conclusion.
div.p:
WEE may well say at our times that wee are in a perverse world, even as it was in the times of Noah, of Lott, and of Christ, of which Christ saith, Luke 7. 31, 32. With whom shall I compare this Generation, and to what are they like; they are like to Children sitting in the Market-place, calling one to another, saying, Wee have piped unto you, and you have not danced, wee have mourned unto you, and yee have not wept; Even so it is in this perverse world in this our time; Wee have many yeares since, from Anno 1619. tould publickly both of a Good and of a bad time, that was at hand, but all was derided and Calumniated, so that they would beleive or receive neither good nor bad; But the Holy Scripture tould thus much aforehand, That in the last dayes there will be scoffers, that walke after their owne lusts, saying, Where is the promise of his comming, 2 Pet: 3. 3, 4. And the Angel saith to Daniel, Chap: 12. 10. Wicked men will doe wickedly, and will not regard it, namely, they will not search into the mysteries of the lust time; but the understanding and Judicious man will Inquire into; Therefore Christ compareth these last times, with the times of Noah, and of Lott, Math: 24. 37, 38. Luke 17. 26, 27, 28. which ought to be observed by reason of the great securitie which was in the times of Noah, and of Lot, even to the day in which the fire and water came, and tooke them all away; Even so it is in our time, and no other, and indeed the Watch men in Israel are most secure, and it is just with them as the Prophet told, let us eate and drinke, and have good dayes, as it is to day, so shall it be to morow, &c. Isaiah the 56. 10, 11, 12. And if a poore man comes and tells them of any thing, then they brand him with the name of a new Prophet, Enthusiast,
Phantast, and Millenary, nay they presume to say, that he is a Messenger of the Devill, and turne him out of Doore.

Thus the Watch men in Israel doe, and which are drunke, and fall along, therefore the 24th Chapter of Isaiah will come on them, as sure as it is written, and the 4th Chapter of Malachy, where unto wicked men and scoffers is denounced a fiery Furnance; as also Thess: 2. the 1. 8. Carelesse ignorant secure men prate of a Peace in our times, but how much they will misse of it, the duple Quinarius will prove it at his comming after few dayes. Seeing there is no remedy for this perverse world, therefore God will deale with them accordingly, Psal. 18. 17. And will sweepe them away with the beesom of perdition, Isaiah the 14th. 23. Nothing shall prevaile against, though Moses and Samuel should stand and intreate for them, Jere: 15. And the Postilion amongst other things, brings the 7th Chapter of Ezekiel, which must be read from the beginning to the end, and the 9th Chapter also, for those which mourne and sigh over the abominations that are committed in Jerusalem, shall be marked and sealed, Revel: 2. Therefore the destroying Angel shall be loosed after the yeare of Libra, to destroy the third part of men, Chap: 9th and 15. and then will be no sparing, and though these should dwell all in one Citie, yet they shall not be able to marry, neither their sonnes nor daughters, but onely the Lord will have a Care over them, by reason of their righteousnesse, Ezek: 14. v: 13. 16. Therefore the Spirit of Prophecy Concludeth thus, Revel: 22. 11. Hee that is unjust, let him be unjust still, and hee that is filthy, let him be filthy still, and hee that is righteous, let him be righteous still, and behold, I come quickly, and my reward is with me, to give every man according as his worke shall be.
